column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This is my first antidepressant. My doctor diagnosed me with depression, but I don't know if I'd call it that. I have anger issues. I think I believed everyone was out to screw me over. I didn't realize I felt this way until I started taking Pristiq. Pristiq really helped me calm down. My family thinks it's a miracle drug. The first couple of days I was a little dizzy, but ridiculously happy.. giddy. I woke up earlier and felt more active throughout the day. My side effects are decreased libido, headaches, and vivid, bad dreams. Throughout the day I'm happy, but at night my dreams bring back all of my angry feelings to an extreme. I've tried a couple times to wean myself off of Pristiq, but I get incredibly anxious, have terrible headaches, "brain zaps", feel jittery, and am very intolerant to other people. Anything and everything makes me want to scream when I haven't taken my meds in a couple days. I'm only taking 50 mg a day, but would love to be able to stop. I'm concerned about the long term effects since it's a fairly new drug.

I take vallium 5MG 3xday a long with Buspar 10MG 3xday and all these combination of medicines have worked very well for me. For those of you that want to take $15.00 a month off your co-pay go to pristiq.com and order their pristiq card. My insurance co-pay is $64.00 per month and now all I pay is $49.00. column2: jojobelle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: When I began taking Pristiq, it was a god send compared to the 75mg of Effexor that a previous doctor had prescribed me.  I took it before bed every night, and it helped lessen my anxiety daily.  However, about 7 months after starting it, my husband and I decided to try for baby #2.  Knowing that Pristiq was not the best drug to be on while pregnant, I consulted with my doctor and she suggested to wean off the drug over a few weeks, starting by cutting the pill in half.  Bad idea.  The next 3 months were complete hell.  The withdrawal symptoms made my anxiety worse, resulting in my throat & nasal passages swelling up to the point where I was prescribed an inhaler and flonase to help with the issue - never had to use those in my life before.  Then the dizziness started, and the headaches.  I believe the headaches also helped detach my retina in my right eye, as I suffered the detachment about 2-3 weeks after reducing my dosages.  So, $58,000 later, I am not a happy camper, and would never recommend this drug to anyone who needs temporary help with anxiety.  This medication is definitely for patients with long term needs.

column2: log3898, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
Karen1122, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Pristiq has worked really wel for me with no side effects. I've been taking Pristiq for almost 2 years and it has been great not crying every day because of my depression. I took Lexapro 20MG for about 2 years, but it wasn't working as well so the doctor added Abilify 15 MG to take with my Lexapro. I also took Xanax 0.5MG for axienty twice daily, which he upped to 4 times a day. That worked for a while, then I got worse again. I was changed to Pristiq50MG and gradually took off of Lexapro and Abiify. 50MG eventualy quit working and he upped it to 100MG. That's what I'm on now and it's working. I still have bad days, but not as frequently. The doctor also took me off of Xanax and added Buspar10MG 3 times a day, Valium5MG 3 times a day, Remeron45MG at bedtime and Ambien10MG at bedtime. The Pristiq wasn't what caused me not to be able to sleep. That's the way my depression affects me. For those of you that has had side effects from Pristiq was probably because it didn't agree with your system. I hope you find something that works for you like Pristiq has worked for me. I was out of Pristiq for a couple of days and I didn't have any withdrawls, but I did cry off and on for 2 days. Once I started back to taking it I was ok. I still have my bad days, but I don't think I will ever find anything that will be 100% effective for me. I just learn to go with the flow and hope that Pristiq will continue to work. For those of you that has to pay a co-pay for your Pristiq go to pristiq.com and they will send you a card to get 15.00 off your co-pay once a month for a year. My co-pay used to be 64.00, but now it's 49.00. I hope for the best for each one of you that goes through depression. May God Bless all of you.

column2: Kira, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I moved from 25mg Lexapro to 50mg Pristiq and I loved it. I lost about 10LB that I was unable to lose with Lexapro. The transition wasn't too bad, I had light flu symptoms for about a week. My OCD and recurrent thoughts were still not under control, so my doc up my dose to 100mg. I am in my first week and I am experiencing flu like symptoms, sadness, tiredness and anxiety. I am confident that these are "transition side effects" like the one I have experienced from Lexapro to Pristiq. We are all different. Work in close ocntact w your doc and stay positive, you will find something that works for you. Please do not get scared by online postings. Again, we are all different and medications affect us differently. Good luck to all!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Very high blood pressure after 6 weeks. Also withdrawal effects of bloating, weight gain, restlessness, dizziness.Drug interfered with orgasms and decreased all hormones in my blood when blood analyzed.

column2: ntucker99, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: With 200mg of Lamictal and 50mg of Pristiq, this is the most stable I have been.  Although not recommended by professionals, I cut the pill in half for the first 6 days.  I am glad I did as I only experienced mild stomach discomfort and a few headaches.  I am now up to fifty and slowly loosing weight.  After using all the recommended mood stabilizers, I packed on 30lbs in 2 years.  Seroquel is the worst.  Before starting Pristiq I was in a terrible mixed state, contemplating suicide everyday for weeks. I was high and low at the same time and irritable beyond belief.  This combination of these two drugs has saved my life so far.  Unfortunately everyone must be patient as you wade through all the drugs that are out there.  What works for one will not for others and sometimes you need combinations.  I have been at this for years now, so I know how frustrating and devastating mental illness and medication trials can be on your life and relationships.  Please don't give up.  I know it's tiring and hopeless at times, but by not giving up you will get there. Pristiq does significantly decrease your appetite, so make what you do eat count.  Fruits, veggies, and lean meats.  Remember to give your medication time to work, and the side effects (except for the decrease in appetite) should subside after a few days or few weeks.  If they don't please reach out to doctor to try something else.  Don't go cold turkey as this could really put you in physical or psychological danger.  I have stupidly gone cold turkey on Paxil and Cymbalta in the past.  I suffered major physical and psychological effects that I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy.  I would recommend Pristiq to others.  Again, stay strong and keep seeing a therapist.  Whatever you do, don't give up.  Many best wishes to everyone suffering.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Didnt realize how much the med controlled my anxiety until I discontinued using. Not sure whether or not it increased appetite but sure seemed to do so. Works well to control emotions and anxiety. The only downside would be that quitting this medicine is a holy terror. I quit cold turkey and was always extremely dizzy and zombie like. Of course, I should have known better than to go cold turkey. Scares me that something can affect a person that much which is why I quit taking it.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Pristiq for the past 7 months, after taking cipralex.  I switched off of cipralex due to high side effects and decreasing effectiveness (I was on this med for roughly 4 years.)  I then started taking  Pristiq at 50mg as my doctor suggested this drug may be very helpful for my anxiety because it is very similar to venflaxine which has numerous side effects.  I found that this switch was helpful and I had a great reduction in side effects.  By the end of roughly 3 months I saw a bit of a decrease in effectiveness so my doctor put me up to 100mg and that has since done the trick.  I am overall side effect free, though i am slightly shaky, however this could be due to my other medication Trazodone which I use as a sleep aid.

column2: animalfriend, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After trying approximately 20 different meds over the past few years with little to no relief, I was diagnosed as having "severe medication-resistant major depressive disorder." After hearing about awful options such as shock therapy, I was started on Pristiq 50 mg. once a day 6 weeks ago. It was WONDERFUL, and amazingly helped me within the 1st 2 days of treatment. Sadly, 2 weeks ago, the bottom fell out. I began having horrible headaches which no medication would relieve, nausea, constant crying, irritability, and extreme anger outbursts. I have felt worse than I did before taking ANY med. My supposed "caring" psychiatrist returned my phone call about this and was colder than an ice cube. He said he had never heard such complaints, and I told him about some of the reviews on this site which totally sounded like my experience. He now has me taking one every other day rather than every day. So, I'm still putting that poison into my system and going through withdrawal at the same time. I was offered nothing to help me through this. It has been a MAJOR disappointment since this med seemed to help so much at first, but then caused even worse problems. PLEASE DON'T TRY THIS MED!!!!!!

column2: abar, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I felt as though I was falling apart, when I looked into the mirror, it had become fragmented and I couldnt put the pieces of myself together. I wasnt functioning, I was severely depressed and it was affecting everyone in my household. I knew in order to put my life back together, i needed help. The dr. prescribed me 50mg of Pristiq for two weeks. I started fo feel better, I had more energy and i was being more productive around the house and happier with my children. Two weeks later I went back and the dr. put me on 100mg of Pristiq. I still have minor anxiety but the depression has all but ceased. It is never easy asking for help, but depression doesnt care how old you are or nationality,or your gender, asking for help is the first phase in recovery. I would highly recommend this medication to someone who is suffering from depression and anxiety. It honestly has helped me pick up the pieces and now when i look in the mirror I see myself glancing back.  It feels good to be whole.

column2: Shark Bacon, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is a really hard pill for me to take, because I was told to take it in the morning, as it was supposed to "wake me up." It's hard to get used to, I guess.It's reduced my anxiety, and I'm a little more evened out and easy going about things that used to really stress me out. I can work through them now instead of panicking and staying stuck in one spot.I was really nauseous at first, probably for the first month of taking it, though.But coming off of it is really hard, making me dizzy and giving me headaches that only go away once I take the pill again. I have yet to stop taking them.

column2: Cinders, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Paxil for over a year and was switched over to pristiq. I have been on Pristiq for 35 days now so just a little over a month.  I am stopping it due to severe side effects. I feel like I'm on speed, I cant slow down my energy level is so high I cant stay still and my mind is racing. The worst part is the dizziness that wont stop along with the headaches which start from when I wake up to the time I lay down to sleep at night which requires me to take a sleeping pill.  My anxiety level increased along with irritability, not sure if that was due to me having constant headaches. I cant seem to eat a meal without using the bathroom slightly after and that just started so the longer I am on this different side effects are starting. This is just not for me.  Good luck to the rest of you out there that are doing wonderful.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Lablady, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started off with Lexapro and it wasn't working so my Dr. changed me to Pristiq 100mg. and its worked wonders. I no longer cry over the smallest thing like I use to. I became depressed after having a few surgeries 6 months apart and I felt like I would never get better. I had no side effects at all. I would recommend this to anyone having depression.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I definitely do not feel as depressed as I was when I first started taking this. I was on Welbutrin before and it blurred my vision so bad that I couldn't see anything I was looking at. I rarely cry anymore and the "low" days are fewer and farther away from each other than they were. I feel mentally like I can think more clearly (the cloud has lifted). I find humor in more things and have more motivation than I did.     One thing I did notice is that I feel achey sometimes, to the point where after standing for short periods of time, I get alot of pain in my lower back and legs. The only thing I can compare the pains and aches to are "growing pains". Sometimes I think I have Fibromyalgia.       I am going to make an appt with my primary care doctor early next year and start looking into my symptoms. Another post on here said that they think Pristiq causes these aches and pains because when they stopped taking it, their body felt better. I am scared to stop taking this because it's the only anti-depressant that has somewhat worked for me. Also, if I don't take my dose (50mg) at the right time each day, I start to feel TERRIBLE (irritability, head has pressure, tension headache, can't concentrate). Once I take my dose I feel better within 45min-1hr. It's a love hate relationship right now so good luck to all of you. If you find you start feeling like you have symptoms of Fibromyalgia, it is probably Pristiq causing it.I am only 25 and too young to feel so weak and achey all of the time.

column2: Squid, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on this drug for almost 2 years now.  I tried Lexapro at first - didn't do anything for me.  I'm on 150mg/day of pristiq. I missed one dose, one time - this drug has a very short 1/2 life.  Don't miss a dose! By about hour 25 of it not being in my symptoms, my withdrawl began and was horrible!  However, once I realized I missed a dose, I took it & within a few hours I was fine.  I have had an increase in headaches - not sure if it's stress or the drug.  It has worked great for me - but I am considering changing due to the cost.

column2: Grjpbeatles2, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking pristiq for 3 years and prior to taking it I was having very severe panic attacks multiple times a day. With pristiq, I was able to work, drive, etc and the panic attacks all but ceased. But now I am having a life threatening allergic reactiin to this much needed medication. I broke out in severe hives, became dizzy, and my lips abd tongue began to swell. My psychiatrist told me I should immediatley discontinue taking pristiq. I did as I was told. I ended up in our local delta center. I am currently still fighting to stay "sane". Pristiq has benefitted me more than it has harmed me. Please trust me when I say that you do not want to ever come off of it like I had to un order to save my life. An allergy can develop at any time with any medication. But I have failed to find a medication that has profitted me as much as this one did.

column2: mari5826, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a female in my late 50's and when I took Pristiq, my hair started falling out a lot.  I didn't notice it until after a few months and realized that it was not just the normal hair loss we should have every day.  The top and sides of my hair have thinned out a lot.  I stopped taking it and went back to Cymbalta and it's been about 3+ weeks now back on Cymbalta and no more hair is falling out, so it definately was the pristiq.  I wanted to be sure before I said this.  I noticed that several other people said the same, that their hair fell out.The medication does have a very bad "chemical" smell to it (the pilldoes).I also use HRT (hormone replacement, but have used that for years without my hair falling out.) It may be that the combination of the two is the problem.  I will never know, but wanted to advise people of what happened to me. Good luck.Also, it did work me for me ok as far as how I was feeling while taking it, but it's not worth loosing all my hair over, while there is other med. I can take, like Cymbalta.

column2: Butterieflie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: First major depressive episode.  Started w/ Lexapro - did not work (stopped the crying, but that is all), psychiatrist put me on 25 mg for 2 weeks, then to 50 mg.  After about 6 weeks, upped it to 100 mg/day....now on 150 mg./day.  Insurance won't cover more than 100mg/day.  Works great for me, considering.... it's a drug, there will be side effects, but nothing major.  I seem to have "slipped" a bit in the feel-good department. Feel like myself most days, but do have some increased anxiety and don't handle stress too well...but all in all, works pretty darn good.

column2: Grateful, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It is the only medication that has worked for me longer than  a year. column2: jenn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on and off antidepressants for the past 10 years.. I was put on Pristiq about 4 years ago after suffering from Panic Attacks and feeling a little depressed.  I took 50 mg daily.. I found that if you didn't take it on the 24 hour mark, the withdrawals started immediately.  I gained 10-15 pounds and after four years felt it wasn't working, or could be causing increased agitation.  I also felt that I became a home body which I never was..  I tried to go off the medicine cold turkey.. SICK... I then cut them and weened off slowly over a long period of time.  I found my senses (hearing/smelling) were immediately changed.. Everything was loud. Everything smelled.  The electrical shocks were unbearable.  Nausau.. Acid reflux was painful.  It has been two months since I stopped taking it and I feel better emotionally, but still physically suffering.. Also, after two weeks after taking it I started having chronic pain throughout my body, to the point of tears and not being to function..  I thought this would pass.. I went to the docs and have now been diagnosed with fibromyalgia..  It is horrible and I am in constant pain.  I've never had this much pain and I know for certain that I did not have this before taking PRistiq.

column2: Azrochavoc, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on almost every anti-depressant out there. Pristiq gave me the best year of my adult life in terms of depression and social phobia. As long as I take my anxiety meds with it like I am supposed to, I get to lead a normal life for the first time in decades. I am 55 and was diagnosised as a Marjor Depressive at 15. Things are so much better now.

column2: ladywesson, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: So far I am quite happy with Pristiq. Mild nausea and feeling jittery subsided after a few days. Overall mood is better, more energy and focus. No other side effects so far. Prozac has helped my depression but made me extremely fatigued. Pristiq has been great so far...I actually get out of the bed at 6am... :)

column2: Bogey5, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Just a little background. I suffered a severe neck injury( 3 surgeries) that rendered me disabled way before my time. Became depressed after I had to resign my job and give up golf and other activities that I loved. I tried several other meds but between the constant pain of my injury and the depression I could barely get out of bed.My Dr. put me on wellbutrin at first and it helped for awhile before I fell back into a rut. Then he suggested 100 mg prestiq ALONG with the wellbutrin and everything just clicked. I know that this may be an strange combo but I also know that it has worked wonders for me ! I have proof every morning as my first hour of the day is still brutal  until the medication takes hold.I now have the energy and resilience to face each day in a positive manor.A little wordy here but if I can help just one person it's worth the extra typing. I now have a renewed and much needed energy level and feel light years better than I had before.

column2: Still hopeful, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Pristiq..  If you want a ride you'll never want to experience ever again, try Pristiq. At 50mg I felt terrible, aggitation, skin crawling, uncertain, like I wasn't even in my own self. (Not sure how else to describe, but if you had this feeling, you understand)  Doctor increased dosage to 100mg, you know, maybe more is better?  Following his advice, I increased the dosage.  Within 4 days, I wanted to die.  My head was dizzy, my ability to talk coherently had diminished, my body felt like I was going to just crawl and die within my own skin.  Suicide definetly became an option and I didn't try, but I didn't want to live either.  I'm no longer on Pristiq nor would I recommend it to anyone, not even my worst enemy.  In the past, I've been on Prozac, Effexor (which was almost, but not quite as bad as Pristiq was for me), Wellbutrin, Lexapro, and Paxil.  Have been on anti-depressants now for 14 years.  Lexapro worked best, but couldn't afford, after I had no insurance.  Prozac worked for 7 years and am not sure why I was taken off.  Doctor said it was for my best interest, and like a dumb fool, I didn't question.  I trusted and 7 years later, I'm still on the roller coaster.  But as for Pristiq, make sure you have doctor who knows what they are doing when prescribing.  Pristiq is or was NOT good for me at all.

I was vomiting all day,had a terrible head ache (strongest I ever had) and extremely dry mouth.I just run to my doctor and told him I do not want to see this drug ever again

column2: debbie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from depression for decades, mild to severe, though somehow functioning professionally, and was excited to finally find a medicine that helped with few side effects.  I felt great with Pristiq, without the lethargy produced by the others.    However, the one side effect I did get has been traumatic and permanent - big bald spots on my scalp, with an irritation that felt like ants crawling over it.   Stopped Pristiq about 6 months ago, after reading a blog with many patients complaining about the same reaction, but still have no hair growth.  As a woman in her 50s, this has been almost worse than the original depression!   This should definitely be listed as a side effect, since so many of us have suffered from it.  Now I get depressed looking at my hair - or rather, scalp!

column2: bypolarbear, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After completely not tolerating Celexa, my doctor switched me to Pristiq, which I have been taking for 6 days now. I'm still completely exhausted all the time; right after taking the pill in the morning, clear through the night. Already dealing with the effects of Celiac's Disease (gluten free), my stomach pains are more intense, frequent, and disabling than my normal. I've had a headache nearly every minute of it, also more severe than usual. My body aches, and I'm hypersensitive to all light and sound. My brain either feels like it's screaming, or completely zombie-blank. I've been told that I'm extremely quiet, and somewhat non-responsive to conversation.Today, day 6, has been the first day I've noticed any lightening of mood. Getting out of bed this morning for work was, for the first time in a while, actually a pleasant task. I haven't had the usual bombardment of depressive thoughts and emotions that I usually experience throughout the day. However, my brain feels so strange that I can barely focus on the fact that I'm having less negative thoughts.I'm staying on Pristiq for the month trial that my doctor gave me, but then we'll see. I've read too much about the horrible withdrawal symptoms and side effects in general to think this medicine will be worth continuing.

column2: Lou44, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Depressed, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken Zoloft,Prozac and other Antidepressants,the all did not work.I am now taking Pristiq.Starting with 50mg each once a day,then went to 100mg once a day.I did feel better in the beginning,but taking Pristiq now for over one year,the side effects are terrible.Blurry Vision,Weight gain,tired all the time but can not sleep,Horrible Migraines and no Sex drive.My Bones are killing me.Dizziness is also another factor.My Doctor prescribed Cymbalta,but then he said I should not take it since it would interfere with the Pristiq.I am tired of being tired all the time,no energy,can't sleep,getting dizzy,no sex drive,and I can not even remember things anymore.I want to get rid of all this.So I will take a chance on the Cymbalta.Lord only knows if this is the right way to go.No matter what,there will be always some side effects with any medications I think.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My doctor (family practitioner) prescribed me Pristiq 1 1/2 years ago as I was dealing with anxiety, panic attacks, and depression resulting from an overload of stress. The drug worked pretty well for me during the time I needed it. I started on 50mg for a month and went to 100mg which I've been on for over a year. It seemed while I was taking it I was more angry, had decreased libido, trouble sleeping, and lack of appetite, but I was feeling more like I was in control of my depression. When I moved last year my new doctor (psychiatrist this time) diagnosed me with adult ADHD which is most likely my depression/anxiety culprit. The Focalin I was treated with evened me out, but then the Pristiq made me more anxious. I've been coming off Pristiq for several months, and it's HARD! I've almost kicked it a couple times but then I get weird random twitches, crying spells and mood swings. I've been sleeping a LOT better, and have found more energy. I've gone from 100mg to 50mg, then to 25mg. I've tried taking them every other day, but then it really interfered with my sleep patterns. I'm finding to get off of this drug takes a LOT of time and good pill cutter.

column2: kenrn55, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm a 55 year old man with major depressive disorder and also taking Victoza for my Diabetes Type II.  You all need to be aware that many anti-depressants don't mix well with Victoza.  I tried Cybalta two different times, and both times it caused me to vomit about nine hours after taking a pill.  When I tried Celexa it also made me nauseous, so my Doctor said we'd try Pristiq.  I began taking 50 mg - and fortunately didn't have any reaction with the Victoza.  But I went for two months without much improvement to the depression.  So two weeks ago my Doc upped the dose to 100 mg per day - I'm still depressed; the Pristiq has only numbed me out a bit - that's all.  I hate being this way and I hope my Psych doctor can come up with a better medicine for me to take.  I've been suffering from depression for far too long.  Therapy isn't helping either.  I want my life back.  In the past I've tried just about all other meds - Effexor, Prozac, Wellbutrin, Sertiline (sic), and many others.  They all worked for short periods then became ineffective.  Cymbalta also worked before I began taking Victoza for my Diabetes.  But Victoza really has helped me - I've lost about 50 lbs in the past year and my AC1 has gone down to 5.6 - an amount unheard of for Diabetic patients (it's usually 6.1 or above).  So I don't want to go off Victoza.  There must be something that can treat this insidious disease.  Hopefully, working with my Doctor we'll come up with something.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: spuff, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: First let me say I do not have any other mental conditions but Major Depressive Disorder since my teens (I am 52). But Pristiq has been the best of all. The only complaint I have (I am on 50 mg. for the last two years) is blurry vision, besides some low libido (which is possibly due to menopause or would be there anyway!) I feel very well most days but I believe a tolerance of some sort develops with all meds so am going to ask about 100 mg. I am starting to have what I call "breakthrough" symptoms like I had with all meds: more crying, sleep problems, and low energy/motivation. I know my symptoms well and don't want to wait til it gets to suicidal thoughts. Still, this medication is wonderful. Don't miss the 1970's and the awful tricyclics or other meds that were tried.

column2: soonerbaby, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I begain taking this medication almost 2 years ago.  It has made a huge difference in my life.  I was at the point that I was crying every day and feeling so overwhelmed by the smallest tasks such as getting up, deciding what to wear, what to eat.  My hormones felt out of control, my menstrual cycles were irregular, and I was on a rollercoster of emotions.  One minute elated and the next in a deep dark hole.  I finally got to a breaking point and visited my gynocologist to do anything she said if I could just feel normal.  She put me on this.  Within days of starting the medication, my emotions leveled out.  My outlook on life became more stable and upbeat. Within a couple of months, my menstrual cycles became more regular and my severe acne cleared up.  A mother of a young child and stressfull job, this medication has saved me.  So far, I have not had any sife effects that I am aware of.  I did at one point in time miss a dose and was an emotional basket case the next day.  Needless to say, I have not missed any since then.  And life is good.  I would recommend researching and talking to your doctor, but this has been a great thing for me.

column2: LKP, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Pristiq was a lifesaver for me.  I was previously on Effexor for 3+ years and went off it when it became ineffective.  Within 3 days of starting Pristiq, I felt normal again.  I could get out of bed, function, work....participate in life!  Pristiq allowed me to feel like myself again.  The only side effects I experienced were 1) decreased appetite (only lasted a few weeks), 2) headaches, 3) persistent dry mouth/thirst, 4) major dizziness when I miss a dose or run out (similar to any other antidepressant).  The benefits well outweigh the side effects!

Now I'm to a point where I'm falling asleep while driving to work. My body is constantly aching somewhere different (mostly neck and arms), I have a chronic skin infection on my scalp and genital region, very odd dreams (when I can sleep), night sweats and absolutely NO SEX DRIVE! My memory is a complete mess. Can't remember simple words, what I had for lunch yesterday or pieces of conversations that just happened. I'm afraid this is going to start effecting my job!  I crave every kind of food imagineable...I think I've gained 10 pounds since I started this med. I'm not an overweight person but since starting, everytime I eat my belly gets so distended, I look pregnant! Not sure whether or not to recommend this med to others...

column2: pal, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this medication as the efficacy of the antidepressants I have taken in the past has worn off.  At first I really like this medicine despite the numerous side affects because it made such a dent in my depression.  I felt more hopeful than I have felt in months, maybe years. Even after describing the side affects at my 4 week appointment my doctor was perplexed I still wanted to be on it.  But the side affects persisted.  They include HIGH anxiety accompanied by fatigue.  So much so that I feel like I can fall asleep sitting up but have anxiety to the point where I have the "jimmy leg."  It is a very odd combination.  Other side effects I've experienced severe hand sweating, goose bumps on my legs, dry mouth, foul smelling flatulence, horrible sleeplessness, sexual side effects and skin sensitivity and canker sores.  Because I could not sleep my MD recommended clonopin for the anxiety.  This just accentuated how anxious I was when it wore off.  Some of the symptoms I started experiencing that increased the longer I took it that I have not seen on the website was the complete lack of concern or caring for others.  I started to want to be alone to the point of wanting to hide under my bed.  I did not care if I ever talked to anyone again and preferred not to interact with anyone.I have since gone off the meds as I realized it is kind of ruining my relationships and I was about to impulsively destroy them with my apathy.  On the 5th day of not taking the 50mg and the fatigue from the absence of the anxiety is still persisting but hopefully when my body recovers from the meds my energy will level off.  I highly recommend if going off the meds not to make plans for a lot of activity because you will laid up with the fatigue.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: I am writing this to warn others of the life threatening nature of this drug.  My husband cannot write this himself, because he died last year due to an extreme low sodium level caused by taking this drug. In his final hours, he lost the ability to speak, started having severe seizures, and he died within 4 hours of arriving at the hospital.  He had gone to his doctor twice in the preceding 2 weeks and reported his flu-like symptoms, but they just dismissed it as a common virus. Within 3 days of his last doctor visit, he was dead.  PLEASE, if anyone experiences any of the side effects such as body aches, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, headaches, confusion, etc... do not wait...insist that the doctor check your sodium level immediately!  By the way, in the total 3 months that my husband took this drug, it never did make much difference in regards to treating his depression either.

column2: JH, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had bipolar disorder all of my life, but only diagnosed at age 48 with major hormonal changes that made me bedbound. I was put on Prozac (HORRIBLE HALLUCINATIONS), then quit drinking all alcolol, and settled on Paxil, Welbutrin, Buspar and Adderall for ADD for the last 8 years which SEEMED to be working. After a several month switch to generics 10 months ago, which was an absolute failure, I got back on my brands, but never got my head back above water, because it seemed that something had lost efficacy. Finally exchanged the Paxil for Pristiq (100mg) over the last month, and so far it is a miracle.  I have NEVER wanted to get out of bed in all the years that I can remember - even with what I thought was working! It is an absolute shock to me that I have the ability to feel like living and doing things. So far side-effects seem to be hypertension (100/150) and headache, but I will figure it out and do anything to maintain this new will to finally LIVE instead of just depressively existing and forcing myself to get out of bed.  I'll write again in a few months with an update (because I finally can maintain an interest and remember to!) (All of this is under the care of a psychopharmacologist and psychotherapist.)   . . .though when things don't work, pseudopharmocologist seems more apt . . .

Again this worked for a while but now I am on 100 mg a day and I do not like the way it is starting to make me feel. I have been on 100 mg for 7 months now. I have weird experiences randomly through out the day. I don't feel like myself, and I still come home irritable and exhausted! Asking for a new medication, but now I am worried about the "coming off" the medication.

column2: Helene, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Pristiq has been an absolute MIRACLE drug for me.  I started taking it in September 2010 and within four weeks I was feeing 100% better.  I have been on antidepressants for almost 20 years and nothing has worked this well for me. I had continued to be somewhat depressed regardess of what I was taking.  I feel so good that I can't believe it's me that is talking and reacting so comfortably with people.  I have had NO SIDE EFFECTS whatsoever.  It is an amazing drug and I hope that it continues to work for me.  I have been on it now for two months and could not be happier with how it is working on me.

column2: Mascenika, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been on 50mg of Pristiq about 2 months now and take in AM as my Dr suggested. Weened off Celexa cuz stopped working. Took both meds for 1 month then lowered Celexa to half (20 mg) for another month. Other meds I have taken over the years are Wellbutrin XL, Lexapro & Paxil. They all stopped working eventually. Symptoms always the same: CAN SLEEP 24 HOURS, NO MOTIVATIION TO DO ANYTHING which leads to extreme guilt which makes everything worse NO SOCIALIZING, leaving home or talking on phone. Still fight the tendancy to sleep but it's much better than before. Thankfully, I have had none of the side affects I have read about. Curious as to how long this med work. Thankful for each day it does. My daughter has this problem also.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
bodlbear, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: i have been on pristiq for 7months and i am now ready to come off.  Besides the severe side effects in the beginning and the constant headaches and all of a sudden now blurred vision (cant read red or blue writing) bit scary and walking in the city on a busy day makes me feel sick.  other than all that it got rid of depression and i have vision for my life again, back at work full time and finished my year out with distinctions and credits at uni. so happy overall.  My concern now is going off it.  do i go one day off one day on and decrease that way???not looking forward to that will be taking two weeks off in february so will do it then.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The medicine made me cloudy headed all day long. I would forget conversations I had or errands I needed to run. Coming off the medication was the worst experience. I slowly came off by taking it every other day for 2 weeks and then every 2 days for two weeks then stopped. I had spins all day and terrible mood swings. The nausea was the worst. Overall I wouldn't recommend this drug to anyone. It did more harm than good.

column2: jimdandy, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was on Effexor XR for about 6 years and was really annoyed by the sexual side effects.  When I quit I was on 150mg/day.  I went directly on to Pristiq 50mg and noticed a difference immediately.  Pristiq is a stereoisomer (specifically rearanged molucule)of Effexor and works the same.. but works without having to take a ton.  My sexual side effects subsided substantially and I feel better on 50mg than I ever did on the 150mg Effexor.  Yes, you have to titrate yourself off if quitting due to the brain shock thing, but that's really the only misgiving I can surmise about this miracle drug.  Very satisfied, and have gotten help paying for it through the manufacturer.  Don't get discouraged... everyones brain chemistry is different.  If this one doesn't work, try another.  Pristiq is for those of us unfortunates with a lack of both seritonin and norepiniphrine.  There are plenty of others that effect one or the other of these levels, and still others that effect dopamine (like wellbutrin).

column1: Extreme Apprehension or Fear of Social Interaction
column2: as, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on it for 3 weeks and it has really helped i no longer feel tired i'm better rested more alert more sociable and happier its not like being high or something it just feeling calm. Hopefully it won't ware off...

column2: groundhog, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: when I forget to take this med for 2 days I get a very nauseating headache.

column2: 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: I just started this drug (50mg) a month ago after being on Zoloft for 2 years.  The difference is incredible.  I have energy, am happier and only experienced slight digestive problems in the one month switch.  Lexapro, Paxil and Wellbutrin never worked for me.  No weight loss as I take Mitazipine (30mg)at night for sleep, which is actually an appetite stimulator.So far so good.

column2: michelle8378, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: at first i was really sick to my stomack and light headed but in a few days i was fine

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: From Lexapro to Pristiq.  Has worked better than Lexapro for anxiety and depression.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: It has completely suppressed libido and has ruined our marriage.  It works very well as an anti-depressant.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I take it once a day with Lyrica that I take three time a day for Fibromyalgia. The medication works best if taken in the morning, if i take it in the evening i am unable to sleep. Also if i miss doses I have very emotional mood swings. Keep under doctors care. I was prescribes to high of a dosage and went through a horrible withdraw. Overall helped with the major pain relief and mood.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
omegaman, 65-74 Male  (Patient)
column9: Eases depression, but not completely. Helps erase thoughts of suicide. Keeps me going on a more even keel. Makes life more tolerable and enjoyable.

column2: ExFootballPlayer, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has helped with my generalized anxiety symptoms and I have developed some mild-moderate social anxiety symptoms and become a bit irritable since I started this treatment.Taking 50mg of Pristiq in the morning.  Supplementing with up to 3 x 0.5mg Ativan per day when needed.  Weaning off Paxil after 11 years.Initial side effects were moderate-severe panic attacks during first 24 hours and then transitioned to moderate drowsiness for next 4 days.  I find this medication is hard on my upper GI system.  I am physically active and this medication has contributed to weight loss.Overall I am pleased with the decrease in generalized anxiety symptoms and find that the low-dose of Ativan helps with the social anxiety symptoms that have developed since I started this treatment.

column2: dawn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: depression due to husband illness

column2: scottpilgrim, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: In the beginning, I felt like I had a bit more energy, and my mood had lightened slightly.  But that went away.  No side effects for me, but no benefits either.  Was on 50mg for a month, then 100mg for 4 months.

column2: jam1957, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Shell, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: If I miss just one dose, then my body aches, I get sick at my stomach.  This feels like withdrawal symptoms.  I am also experiencing constipation at times.

column2: solitaryman, 55-64 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Headache for the first days and now I feel generally better and hope it continues.  I did feel a little nausea the fist 3 or 4 days and that seems to be going away

column2: omegaman, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: For me, most effective medication I've tried.No bad side effects.

column2: bayougirl,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 50 mg of Pristiq daily for 7 days now...the only side effects I have experienced so far was mild drowsiness & excessive yawning. I also feel a bit calmer and not as anxious or short tempered as I was before I started taking this medication.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
BlessedX5, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have found that reviews tend to be written by those who are generally unhappy with a product and don't always take them too seriously as we all view things differently; however, when it comes to our health we need to pull together here as we only have one body and one life!  Pristiq did put on a few lbs. on me, but in all fairness, most anti-depressants will.  I have absolutely NO sex-drive whatsoever, which is completely unlike me and my neuropathic pain is still there?!  I do think it has helped me with some depression, for sure. With that said, I don't know if it's worth staying on pristiq as I am still in constant pain and the headaches and fibromyalgia are so very severe.  I have been on this for well over 6 months+ now and I have given it well enough time for it to work!  I hope this helps.

column2: 311fan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: At first, this medication was great. It helped with my anxiety. After the first few months, i started experiencing weird side effects. They started with heartburn. Within a month, I went through a bottle of tums. My dr gave me an acid reflux prescription to take with it. After a week, I started feeling nauseated. After a month of both symptoms, my dr gave me something for the nausea. Then, I started puking a few hours after eating. Within a couple of weeks, the puking came closer and closer to the time that I ate. After a few weeks, I was puking before I even ate and right after. My dr sent me for test after test because she said it couldn't be the medication. Well, I wasn't allowed to take the medication before the tests so they came back negative. After being constantly dehydrated I finally just stopped taking the medicine. I was better immediately. I could be a rare example, but I would stop if you start experiencing heartburn with this medication.

column2: solitaryman, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have taaken a few different anti-depressants and this is the second day and I did experience rapid speech the 1st day.  Seems like I felt better the very 1st day but it's just too early to tell.  Will write as often as I remember the good and the bad about this medication as I go.

column2: mimi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Pristiq for about 4 weeks and I am feeling great.  The first week I was concerned because it calmed my anxieties so much that I felt somewhat stone-faced (no emotion), but that soon subsided.  My side effects are minimal such as dry mouth and drowsiness at times.  I have not had nausea.  My most noticable effect is the sexual side effect.  I also take Tamoxifen, which can cause this side effect.  However, I did not have this problem when only taking Tamoxifen.

column2: omegaman, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Works 90% of the time. Everyone has a bad day once in a while. Only complaint: occasional minimal nausea and lightheadedness. Best yet.

column2: Me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This med has worked better than others, thus far.  My only advice is to be aware of the side affects before beginning.  I was not.  I got very dizzy while doing house work and thought I was dieing.  I couldn't eat for days (not so bad)at first.  The symptoms will subside eventually, so be patient.  It is worth it.

column2: colleen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I still have the depression and sadness, I just don't cry constantly

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm going on day 9. The first 5 days were awful. Nausea, Severe headache, eyes out of focus/blurry, jittery, can't sleep, appetite supressed, my arms felt like they were on fire, severe ringing in the ears.Day 9 and most of the side affects are subsiding. My vision is still not right, still not sleeping well, ringing in the ears is still there, but better. It seems that I wake up in a great mood, take my meds then within a couple hours some of the side affects kick in. I'm hoping within a couple more weeks that there will be no side affects. I like having more energy and feeling better about life.

column2: unlucky_dude, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It didn't work for me:Day 1 (ON): Within two hours: My head felt like it was on fire.  I was extremely nauseated, anxiety became 100 times worse.  My neck pain is goneDay 2 (ON):  My head still feels like it is on fire.  My neck pain is gone.  Depression is magnified 100 times.  Anxiety 100 times.  Nauseated beyond belief.  I am shaking like crazy.Day 3 (ON):  My head still feels like it is on fire.  My neck pain is gone.  Depression is magnified 100 times.  Anxiety 100 times.  Nauseated beyond belief.  I am shaking like crazy. My neck is back.  I cannot feel my legs.Day 4 (OFF): My head still feels like it is on fire.  My neck pain is magnified.  Depression is magnified 100 times.  Anxiety 100 times.  Nauseated beyond belief.  I am shaking like crazy. My neck is back.  I cannot feel my legs.Day 5 (OFF): My head still feels like it is on fire.  My neck pain is back to normal.  Depression is magnified 10 times.  Anxiety 10 times.  Nauseated beyond belief.  I am shaking like crazy. I am starting to get the feeling back in my legs.Day 6 (OFF): My head no longer feels like it is on fire.  My neck pain is back to normal.  No depression.  Anxiety is back to normal.  Still nauseated.  Shaking much less.  I can feel my legs again.  Hooray.Day 7 (OFF): Everything back to how things were before trying Pristiq.

column2: Thankful, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been depressed/anxious for years and have tried almost all other antidepressants; too many side effects like weight gain and minimal improvement other than for Paxil.  Pristiq has worked extremely well, as I had almost given up on them.  Got into trouble with Klonopin dependency and am glad I have found something that works other than that class of drugs.  Minimal to no side effects.

column2: Mary, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Prestiq for almost 2 weeks.  Very nervous and am living on Xanix.  Not sure if this is for me.  Took Effexor XR for years but went off - mistake.

column2: Wilma, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Pristiq in November and noticed my mood changed for the good almost immediately.  That part was great.  Around Thanksgiving I started getting sick and throwing up every time I laid down.  I had 4 EGDs and they wanted me to have surgery on my stomach because my esophagus was closed us.  On my own, I quit taking the pristiq and the vomiting stopped.  As a test, I started it again a month later and it closed up my esophagus.  I guess that's an allergic reaction.  Too bad.  It certainly made me feel better mind and energy wise.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Lexapro for nearly 2 years and gained 20 pounds. I have always been a thin person so this was upsetting. I weaned myself off Lexapro and then experienced a family crisis which required me to be back on medication in order to function in my highest degree. My doctor introduced me to Pristiq, which has been great, other than the sweating. No matter the temperature, I have gross underarm sweat. But, considering I was immobilized by anxiety and depression, I would take the embarrassing sweats. Lexapro was great while it lasted. My Dr. told me that if you have any liver disorders (which I don't, but I do enjoy my glass of wine) Pristiq was a better choice. I do have a prescription card my dr. gave me that allows 50% off my meds. That brings my 30 day supply down to $17.  I would certainly love to be medication free, but Pristiq allows me to live without debilitating anxiety and depression.

column2: June, 75 or over Female  (Patient)
column9: It has made such a change in my behavior, going from being tired, sad, feelings of guilt, and isolating myself from other people.

column2: James, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on pristiq for about two years. It works very well. It is easy on my system. It is a strong medicine, so don't run out. I can go for two days without it, but it starts to get a little uncomfortable. This needs to be tapered down to get off of it. I am always surprised by people who write bad experiences. The medicine was very effective in the beginning. After a year I upped it from 50 to 100mg thinking I would have another honeymoon experience on pristiq. There were no major changes in two years, I guess it was more noticeable in the beginning.  My life is stable and I'm not hitting any super lows since pristiq.

column2: Barbara, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Two words: EXCESSIVE SWEATING. I could not live with it.

column2: Steve, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: More energy. No more depressive thoughts. Feel better about myself. Got me thru Chemo Therepy with a Positive Attitude.

column2: belladonna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this is not as good as Wellbutrin XL but had to switch due to insurance costs. This medicine makes me feel hazy and totally hungry for sugar. My sex drive is gone??? I hate that insurance companies play with our lives

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was taking Effexor XR (which that worked perfectly fine) but switched to Pristiq to try and minimize my severe night sweats. Since taking the Pristiq the frequency of my night sweats have decreased. I have only been taking it for a few weeks now but I will continue to take this because it is pretty much the same thing as Effexor XR (main ingredient). If someone is currently taking Effexor XR and having issues with the side affects from it I would recommend asking your doctor about taking Pristiq instead. But if you do decide to switch to this make sure you get off the effexor gradually like you did when you first started taking it because I know I had some pretty nasty side affects from just stopping it cold turkey and starting the pristiq right away. Just make sure to talk with your doctor about all of these different things to make sure you do have the best experience possible.

column2: Creek1967, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: One of the best I have used.  I was a little nauseous the first week but not unbearable.  It only took 4-5 days before I started feeling better.  I do get nauseous if I miss dose (approx 4 or 5 hours after missed dose).  I take 50mg a day with Lamictal.

column2: zumba gold, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Pristiq is a timed released medicine so if you are late taking it,  you will feel like wind is in your head or brain zaps.  I try to take it first thing when I get up each morning.  It seems to give me energy.  I am on 100 mg.  I am always going through a crisis, it seems (LOL),so I still feel discouraged at times and overwhelmed.  I guess it can't take away all those feelings all the time.  Overall,  I feel like it is doing a good job helping me,  but I almost feel like I need something to go with it.  I just retired from teaching and my health insurance is over $2200.00 a month,  My husband just found a tumor in his neck , and my mother in law has moved in with us.  I figure this is why I feel so hopeless.  I don't think they make a pill that can handle too much stress.

column2: MPQkimo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After trying many, many different anti-D meds in the past, currently taking Pristiq and its currently working. I'm liking this for the first time in ages. No side effects for me either.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
yeyeye, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: horrible horrible horrible!! worst headaches of my life, could not function at work. Worst one i have ever taken. dont try.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
gee0379, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking pristiq for about 2 weeks now and I have been getting a whole lot worse with my symptoms. All I want to do is cry, not eat and sleep all day... I thought this medication would help me a lot better since the doctor took me off of citalopram (which I did not feel any better with that one either) It really sucks that we as depressed people have to live like this. And lets not to forget that this medication is way too expensive!

column2: Rachael, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was only on this medication for two days and it gave me such a bad headache I had to stop taking medication... Also gave me diarrhea and no motivation at all! Felt better without taking medication and just "dealing" with the anxiety!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: When I began treatment I suffered from headaches, acne, insomnia and mood swings.  I've been on the drug almost one year and things have improved.  I still experience trouble sleeping, itching and weight gain.

column1: Extreme Apprehension or Fear of Social Interaction
column2: Little Aussie Battler, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: A few years ago, my doctor prescribed me with a medication to treat work related depression. To much dismay, this medication did not work for me. As time went on, my depression became worse and my fear of social situations grew larger. I started to withdraw from society, work, play - my life. After I lost my job, I become a wreck.  Knowing that I had to gain some control over what was happening to me I went to see a new GP this year who prescribed me with Pristiq 50mg. With such a huge stigma attached to medications to treat mental illness, it was hard for me to accept the prescription. I have been seeing a psyhcologist for a month and have been on Pristiq for 2 months. I can tell you that my concentration levels have improved greatly, my thoughts have seemed to slow down and I feel less anxious in social situations. I still feel me, not a zombie walking around in a haze like I felt with other medications. I am having a great night sleep. I am retaining more information too. Which is good because I am doing a university degree :-) I am becoming more involved with study groups and I don't worry as much about being in the group. My weight has stayed around the same too. Which is always good for us women :-) This drug is great, thank you for reading, good luck with your journey.

column2: Joy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Pristiq for 6 weeks.I went to my doctor 3 days ago and he is now taking me off as he was "extremely worried" about my worsening depression. It has severely worsened to the point of suicidal thoughts and plans, which my Dr. pointed out that this now put me one step away from being hospitalized. I have all of the side effects, sweating, irritablility, but mostly deepening depression.Can't get out of bed or can't sleep, can't do simple tasks and all this makes a person even more depressed.Cry a lot, and hate my self. The lowest I have ever been in my life. This medication has no right being on the market. The damage it has caused to me and my children, husband and family in the last 6 weeks is unrepairable and unforgivable.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug is the worst! I was fine on Paxil CR, I changed doctors, was told that Pristiq would be good for me and now after months of hell, my job is suffering and my mariage is about over. The Pristiq made me feel sick and limited my ability to think clearly which affected me doing my job efficiently. I then stopped it "cold turkey" which I know you are not supposed to do, but I had to get off of it. For a week, I could not eat, yelled at my family for everything they did and could not do my job. I even went to my family doctor because I thought that I was going to have a stroke or heart attack because I had pains in my chest and a bad headache. Finally, after about a week and a half, I was "free" of the symptoms of withdrawal. I then could not go back on the Paxil because of another drug this doctor has prescibed for me, Vyvanse, which was crazy because it is for ADHD, and I do not and have never had ADHD. Ever since going off the Paxil, I have been a real bitch to live with, and now my husband is talking divorce and taking the kids. I am now off of Vyvanse also and feel better than ever...thinking more clearly on my job, etc. I am just depressed about how these drugs ruined my life for the past 6 months. I am now trying different things to help with depression and my exploding at every little thing. My husband and I are "trying" to work things out even though I can barely stand him anymore. I am now trying Lexapro, and that is giving me headaches also. I will probably end up going back to Paxil...just haven't yet because I was told that it makes you gain weight, and that is the last thing that I want. I would take Pristiq off the market if I could...heard too many bad things about it as well as experienced its detrimental effects.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: One dose of this made me weak, dizzy, trouble sleeping, nauseous, and eventually vomited. I am afraid to try it ever again- even though some people say if you can get past the first few weeks of side effects it is a good med. I can't imagine ever subjecting myself to that again.

column2: padrickgail1963, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it has caused me to have suidical thoughts and cutting myself. i am experiencing severe depression. i cannot see my dr at this time due to financial reasons. i don not recommend this drug to anyone!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: TOOK FOR ONE MONTH SEVERE HEADACHES WEIGHT GAIN..BAD SWEATS,IRRATABILITY.SENSATIVE TO NOISE,AND SMELL OFF OF THIS TOO EXPENSIVE ALSO....NO WAY.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
LATRICE PRINGLE, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I DO SWEAT ALOT MORE THAN I AM USED TOO.BUT I DO FEEL ALOT BETTER. IWAS ON CYMBALTA AND IT WORKED GREAT TOO BUT WHEN I SAW THE COMMERCIAL FOR PRITIQ I THOUGHT I MAY BE ABLE TO FEEL EVEN BETTER AN D I DO

column2: altate, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After a year on Pristiq I'm feeling that some of the effectiveness may have diminished. I have days when I feel depressed for no reason. And even taking the pill at the same time every day, I have days when the "brain zaps" break through and I feel terribly strange. Out of body.On the other hand, I don't find myself feeling overwhelmed by everyday tasks anymore. I still have some stressful situations to work through - but when they're past I want to try to wean off.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on Pristiq for 3 weeks now, I have noticed a big difference in my moods. I have more energy now. The only thing I don't like about it is, The bad taste in my mouth, but all in all I do like it a lot. I would recommend this to others for sure.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Pristiq...just hearing the name makes me cringe. I was put on this medication by an ignorant, stupid doctor trying to promote this horrid medication. He put me on this medication for my anxiety disorder, and guess what?! It did absolutely nothing for me and made me even more depressed and anxious than before I was taking the pill. This medication made me very angry, irritable, moody, and very dull at times. It made me so tired that I slept fourteen hours every single day just to be able to keep my eyes open for more than a couple hours. Pristiq was making me avoid my friends and family. I felt like doing nothing all day long. I just simply didn't care. I finally had to go to a therapist when my depression and anxiety was at it's highest peak and she said she wanted me off of this medication ASAP. I'm currently withdrawing from it after being on it for about three months. I feel like I am going through a living HELL. My head feels like it will explode at any minute, My heart rate is always high, I can't even stand up, i've puked two times today, and I cannot concentrate whatsoever. This is my first week...I can't even get through being without the med for two days without feeling like complete CRAP. I am currently taking it every other day. I'm never seeing that doctor again. Please warn your friends and family to never EVER use this drug. It made me worse and turned me into it's robot. I wouldn't even be writing a review right now if I didn't hate this medication with a fiery passion. WORST DRUG EVER!!!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!

I also had to be on an antin=biotic Bactrim DS would that have caused that reaction with pristiq because I have been on Bactrium before many times.. Hope it works for someone else..

column2: 2upsadazee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken Pristiq 50 mg. for about 3 yrs. w/Wellbutrin 100 Mg.  Until a yr. ago I was stable.  Since May, 2010 I have high b.p. (new med. for that) and today my LDL is high.  I just read these are 2 side effects from Pristiq, yet my Psych. dr. or family dr. mentioned it.  I guess we all have to be our own advocate. Pristiq has worked well for me & I don't know for sure if it is THE cause of high b.p. & high LDL.  I don't know how to handle this situation.

column2: neesie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Been on Pristiq about 8 months or a little less. I thought it had stopped working until I tried to go off of it. DO NOT TRY TO TAKE YOURSELF OFF THIS MED!! I have been crying for the last 2 days & decided to start back taking it. Sometimes we don't want to be dependent on meds but sometimes we have to. It's great when it's working. Note too that I have peri-menopause working against me.

column2: Timeless, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this prescription for a little over a year now, I tried *many* different anti-depressants and can say this is the only one that worked *well* for me, I can also say that I noticed a huge difference in a little less than a week. BUT... now that I'm trying to come off of it I am having horrendus nasuea/dizziness and the worst headaches I've ever had a few hours after I would have normally taken this medication (I've had migranes, this is far worse) so beyond having to be very, very careful about not missing a dose and having trouble getting off this stuff I've only occasionally noticed that it would make me fatigued, but not severely so.  I apparently tolerated this better than most.  I did notice that I would get a weird metallic taste regularly in the back of my throat for about the first 6 months... now it's a hit and miss kind of thing, but at least once a week.  Neither my primary nor my psych were concerned with it after I checked out healthy otherwise.  I work in the medical field and am very in tune with my own body and what I'm putting into it, but beyond the weird nausea/headaches/dizziness thing if I missed a dose by mistake or now that I'm working on getting this stuff out of my system I can say this has literally saved my life.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had been in denial as a teenager, resisting going onto any medication.  Was on paxil as my first exposure.  Took the edge off.  Have been on Serzone, had realllly bad side effects, Celexa was okay, and most recently Effexor XR 75 mg. for the past 2 years or so.  I didn't feel that it was working well for me.  Instead of working with a doctor, I took myself off the effexor cold turkey. It has been 5 weeks today.  I have gone through such varying degrees of regression and improvement.  Explained how I feel and dr. prescribed Pristiq.  I don't know if I should start back on meds period or see if I am able to cope without being on anything.  I do not like the side effects of these meds.  I don't know if they help or hinder me from being independent from meds. Any of this make sense?

column2: esther, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I don't want to stop using this drug just yet in order to find a cause, as I'm hoping that something else is to blame

column2: Effexor no more, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am SOOOOOOOOOO happy I tried ths miracle med.  I am 32 and was diagnosed with ocd, anxiety, and depression when I was 18.  I have been on and off Zoloft since I was diagnosed. At first Zoloft helped with my diagnosis but I had a lot of side effects including; NO sex drive, being tired all the time, and feeling flat(not happy or sad).  I also tried Paxil, Wellbutrin, and Buspar.  This is the only med for me.  I have only been on Pristiq for 5 days but I already feel happier and best of all hello libido!  I thought I was going to live out the rest of my life on a rollercoaster of being on and then taking myself off of the Zoloft and on no meds just so that I could feel closer to my boyfriend.  You do not have to choose between happiness and a libido!  Thank you Pristiq!!!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: APRIL, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Pristiq is a miracle worker. I feel as though a weight has been lifted from my shoulders. I feel better everyday than I ever have. It has helped with my depression and anxiety. column2: cstevens2121, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 23 and have been taking Pristiq for almost 6 months and couldn't be happier with the results of treatment. I have experienced little to no side effects. The only down fall of course is the decreased sex drive which is common for most depression/anti-depressant cases. I was not pleased when my doctor wanted me to try an anti-depressant. I didnt think I was depressed! For years I had been experiencing stomache problems, fatigue, headaches, inconsistent sleeping habits. I honestly thought it was from food allergies or some kind of intestinal problem. After trying a gluten free diet, many blood tests, stool tests, etc the conclusion was to try an anti-depressant. My Doctor started me on Pristiq gradually then increased to a full dose.I didnt start to feel a differnece until after the first month of taking Pristiq and it has only gotten better. Not only do I feel better physically I mentally feel like myself again! The clouds have parted! Its like having a cold for years that finally went away. The plan is to take Pritiq for 6 months then gradually decrease the dose to see how I reposnd. If all is good I will eventually be able to stop. If not I will continue taking the medication. My doctor explained to me some people only need treatment for 6 months, 1-2 years. Those who try and get off and experience horrible side effects are meant to stay on treatment...some for the remainder of their life. I am just thankful to have had a great experience with Pristq!

column2: Sarah, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The medication did help with depression, but also caused me to gain 30 lbs.What upsets me is the level of suffering that I'm going through in getting off of the medication.  At no point in the literature, or from the doctor was I advised of what it would be like to get off of the medication.  It's painful!  It's agonizing! Dizzy, nauseous, headaches, brain zaps (imagine an electrical current in your brain), hypersensitive to sudden sounds.Telling a person of side effects that might happen while on the medication isn't enough.  We need to know what happens if we stop taking the medicine.  These symptoms would happen if I missed a single dose.  I became tethered to my medicine and that's no way to live.I'm on day 5 of withdrawl.  My husband is worried about me.  My kids say I look awful.  I feel like crap.

column2: ArtisteBleue, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Initially, it made me nauseated and very, very drowsy.  However after a few weeks, I began feeling much better -- more self-confidence, less depression & anxiety -- like someone turned on the lights.  My mother passed away 7 weeks ago and, had I not been on Pristiq, I don't know that I could have handled the grief as well.  The only side effects I've experienced are:  cold sweats, some insomnia, sleeping longer than normal in the morning, brain 'zaps', and some minor short-term memory problems.  It is important to follow directions EXACTLY as indicated.  Take at precisely the same time every day and DO NOT mix with alcohol, etc.  It was extremely hot outside yesterday and I had a beer later in the evening.  Needless to say, I had some truly horrific dreams!  Oh, and don't watch CSI  before retiring in the evening either.

column2: designr3@sbcglobal.net, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with depression for more than 25 years, I have used several types of anti-depressants including but not limited to Lexapro, Prozac, Surmontil, Venlafaxine, Effexor. I am currently trying to get back on Pristiq, but my insurance will not cover the cost. I did not lose sleep, nor did I gain weight or suffer from anxiety while taking Pristiq. I felt no negative side effects.  I like that I only had to take one in the morning and not twice daily because I would forget the one later in the day.
