column2: kdredsea, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had extreme intrusive voices for over 30 years; they have suddenly become quieter than ever in my whole life.  I cannot tell you how much easier this makes getting up, going to sleep, and not wanting to die.

column2: LifeIsGood, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Use of this medication has changed my life.  I have been taking Pristiq 100 mg. for 3 1/2 months now.  I have used numerous antidepressants over the years.  Never found one that I felt I could continue on due to side effects and lack of emotional feelings.  I began to feel better within 1 - 2 weeks of taking it although t took about 2 months of taking this medication daily to eliminate some of the initial side effects such as inability to fall asleep and some crazy dreams.  These side effects were minimal compared to benefits of this drug.  First time I've ever felt I can continue taking a medication to keep myself from the continual ups and downs that depression and anxiety has caused in my life.  My advice to anyone is to not give up taking it too soon.  I am happier and have more energy than I've had in 30 years (since my teens), yet still have the ability to cry when appropriate and has not diminished sexual desire as so many other medications have done in the past.

column2: rambrch, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug was added along with my treatment for anxiety. It has helped when no other drug has worked in the past. It does make me sleepy.

column2: Sue, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The best drug I have used to treat anxiety.  No side affects after dry mouth passed.  Tried 6 other drugs and none compared.  Excellent drug.

column2: Upsidedown, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have been on 50mg for 2 years for depression and plan to get off as soon as possible for these reasons.  Over 30 lbs. weight gain even with regular weekly exercise at a gym 3 times or more a week (cardio and weight controlled exercises), and a daily caloric intake of no more than 1800-2000 calories daily.  Also, periods of extreme and swift onset of sweating, nausea, feeling like I'm going to black out.  Every night my weird and vivid dreams wake me with fear and sadness, often keeping me awake for hours.  In addition to the extreme cost, I'm retaining so much fluid and my blood pressure is always high.  Just too many negatives for me to continue on this drug.  I think these experiences have created more stress than the drug relieves.  I'm sure that it has positive effects for some of the population, but after reading other reviews, it appears that there are more of us who have had negative effects.  Can't wait to be eased completely off this nightmare!!

column2: Lindseyk1115, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Lexapro had no affect on my mood so I was put on Pristiq. Felt better at first and was increased to 100mg after 3 mos. Now my mood seems to be regressing and I'm on edge and still quite emotional. I also notice that if I miss even an hour of not taking the pill each day, I begin to feel dizzy and have very weird black out or passing out sensations. I've also noticed that if something makes me very angry, I have the same strange sensations in my head. I tend to want to shake my head as if I'm shaking off the feeling and it goes away. Regardless, I don't like the feeling at all and it's becoming more frequent. Besides, since there is no generic I have to pay $30 every month which is too expensive for a single mom.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: doc put me on this for depression and anxiety. couldn't sleep, no appetite, amped up. Had to stop taking it when i woke up and realized i was grinding my teeth all night long on this. not for those who stuffer from anxiety w depression

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug is excellent, the fist I felt I was soeeding the second, and third week I felt a little drowsioning. I feel so much better, I only been taking it for four weeks.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with anxiety and depression by a psychiatrist because I was stressed out, mentally exhausted and could not concentrate. I was not sad, but did cry from frustration every once in a while. I was totally happy if I didn't have to think about anything. Took kids ice skating, dining out and spending time with friends. After taking Pristique for about 1 to 2 weeks I did not even want to leave my house or be seen by anyone. All I wanted to do was sleep and eat. I was even uncomfortable walking in to pick up our carry out pizza or buy cigarettes. Not sure if it had anything to do with the fact that I gained 16 pounds in 2 weeks and felt like a big fat cow. Maybe I was misdiagnosed, but Pristique did not work for me.

column2: flaca, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am overall satisfied with the medication, but when I forget to take it or run out of my medication I feel terible,nausea, headache, very weak, and diarrhea...literally feel like if I am going to die.

column2: rhonda, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: my experience with this drug was very good initially as of late i have had freinds indicate my personality has changed starring into space non emotive and forgetfulness and increased blood pressure.

column2: Animasaun923, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I felt a difference in 3 weeks...a big difference!  I was at my lowest point in life and am on my way to be better than ever!  I didn't have any side effects like nausea or headaches...but I have been experiencing very very dry skin on my face and scalp and my hair is shedding A LOT in the shower!  I am pretty sure it is a side effect and I am calling my doc about it today, because that is not at all normal for me.  Overall, I am very satisfied with this medication- I hope that these side effects go away or are being caused by something else.  I wonder if anyone else is having this problem.

column2: shelbi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Pristiq for about a year.  Before that I had been on Lexapro, which was great except that it made me sleepy, especially during meetings at work.  So I needed to change.  At first Pristiq seemed to work great!  I wasn't sleepy and things seemed to be under control.  After a few months, I seemed to get more irritable with things and felt anxiety.  After my insurance copayment went to $50 for a month of Pristiq, I knew it was time to quit.  I have been off Pristiq for 6 days now and I had no idea about the withdrawals.  I thought a day or two of being dizzy, ahhhh no problem.  Well Saturday I had my kids and grandkids over and that I was gonna die with the dizziness and irritability and my brain not wanting to work.  I haven't been sleeping much and when I do I have been dreaming weird stuff.  I have had headaches and nausea.  I feel like I can't sit still and have had photosensitivity and my dog barked and it sounded 10 times louder than it normally does.  Live and learn I guess.  I will NOT be taking this again.  Good luck going through the withdrawals and hang in there when you do!!!

column2: Jenna, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on pristiq for 6 months and have loved it until today.  I was on lexapro in college-slept for two weeks and on prozac a few years ago-was clearly suicidal.  Pristiq has greatly helped with the depression, negative thinking, negative outlook-it really changed my world for the better.  The only negative side effects were dilated pupils, infrequent headaches, and vivid, bad dreams.  The benefits were an obviousl lifting of the depression, a better mood, a slight decrease in appetite, and a noticeable decrease in dismenorrhea!!  So, everything was wonderful until today.  I had a horrible period friday-I must have thrown up my pill.  Then yesterday (Sun), I forgot to take it.  This morning I was throwing up, horribly nauseated, had the pins/needles sensation in my whole body when I moved, had a numb tongue and lips, and had little black-outs.  I looked up withdrawl symptoms from pristiq and it looks like these are all par for the course.  I plan on continuing on the med because of the benefits-but I am now aware of how important it is to take the pill every day or taper off when I am ready.

column2: lusy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have severe Panic Disorder and General Anxiety Disorder.  I absolutely hate the thought of taking medication for them, but these disorders started to take over my life.  I finally went to a Psychiatrist to try therapy and he said a combination of medication and therapy would work best...I agreed to take Pristiq.  Since starting Pristiq I've had severe fatigue, headaches, dizziness, trembling, blurred vision, my blood pressure has raised and my menstrual cycle has stopped.  I've been thoroughly checked for pregnancy and any other underlying medical condition and I'm perfectly healthy.  It's unfortunate because Pristiq seemed to relieve some of the panic and anxiety I had but I couldn't deal with the numerous side effects from the drug.  Good luck to anyone taking it, just keep in mind that just because this happens to some people doesn't mean it'll happen to you, medication effects us all differently.

column2: Justsayin',  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has not only helped with my mood, anger/crying/rage/indifferance/stress, but has also controled early onset of menopause. This is a progressive dosage drug so you may start out on 50mg and have to go  up to 100mg so be aware of any mood changes  even if you are feeling better and tell your doctor. I have gained  lots of weight (30 lbs 2 yrs or so on drug) so I recommened adding exercise  program at least 3 times a week as you start to feel better. column2: Attila the Hen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After several years of decreasing effectiveness and increased doses and side-effects of Zoloft, Lexipro, Effexor, Wellbutrin, and Cymbalta, my doctor switched me to Pristiq shortly after it was released. It was far more effective with my depression without the side-effects than any of the others. No side-effects other than a serious anxiety attack about 6 weeks after starting Pristiq, and less than a 5-lb weight gain the 1st year. 3 wks ago I refilled my  prescription. Since then I have been experiencing a constant metallic taste, severe itching after taking a pill, worsening night vision (I've had cataract surgery), headaches like you get with "caffeine withdrawal", insomnia, and, despite eating less because the metallic taste makes food, beverages tasteless and even water tastes metallic, I have gained over 10 lbs in 10 days. I noticed that the new batch of pills is lighter pink than previous ones, and I suspect that the mfr has changed the formulation since my previous refill 3 months ago and that the new formula is causing the problems. Wondering if anyone else is having a similar experience with the "new" Pristiq...and going to see my dr. and get my cholesterol checked.

column9: My depression has been severe enough to make a Christmas fruitcake blush I have lost count of how many years I was on wellbutrin after -0- responses to zoloft and lexapro I am amazed that my "hot buttons" are not being triggered now that I am on Pristig This medicine is very unforgiving in that it MUST be taken with food I tried it without food and I begain to feel intoxicated within 3 days This is typical of how I reflect a drug interaction requiring that I cease taking the new medication immediatlely, which I did A chat with the nurse in my neurologist's office convinced me to try again and to follow my therapist's instructions to-the-letter before panicking Sure as shooting all went well and I am all the better for it! column2: missruth, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Four days ago I started to take a sample pack of Pristiq that my doctor gave me to help treat depression. After doing research on it, I decided to immediately discontinue the drug.  Along with depression, I also suffer from anxiety and ADD, so I am prescribed Xanax (when needed) and Adderall.  If you aren't aware, Adderall is pretty much a stimulant. Well, Pristiq is a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor, which also has some stimulatory effects. This now means I have 2 stimulants in my body that can likely cause an overdose of NRI (Norepinephrine Reuptake Inhibitors) which may cause some of these horrible and uncomfortable side effects: high blood pressure, increased heart rate, severe anxiety, paranoia, dilated pupils, muscle tremors, angina, heart attack, heart failure, it can cause a coma or even death!!!!    The first time I took Pristiq was at night and I didn't get any sleep at all! The next day I crashed and slept it off. A few other side effects I have already (after only trying it for 4 days) is high blood pressure, dilated pupils, frequent urination, dry mouth, headache, a mild case of angina, I keep clenching my jaw, insomnia, I'm very hot most of the time, and my body is hurting from staying up so long.     The good side is that I think I feel a little bit happier, my mind is alert and focused, and I have more energy in the daytime if I get enough sleep the night before. All I can say is that I'm glad it was just a sample so I won't feel bad throwing it away.

column9: I have been on Pristiq for almost 2 yrs. After having my son in 2008, whom was born with a heart defect, I became severly depressed. After trying zoloft, and lexapro, both made me feel very sick, doctor said to try Pristiq. I noticed a great difference, I was able to deal with my son being sick, all seemed well, he needed to have open heart surgery at 9mnths. He is doing awesome now, wish I could say the same for myself. After his surgery in 09', I noticed a huge down fall in my health. I started having severe panic attacks. Went to cardiologist, had lots of test done, they found a hole in my heart, personally I think its from Pristiq. I have been healthy my whole life I now feel like I am on my death bed. I had heart surgery in Feb 2010, I'm still having the panic attacks and dizziness, pain all over my body, blurry vision, headacks, terrible brain zapps, sweaty, cold sweats, can't sleep(so I take Ambien), chest pains so bad I can't breathe. Had to goto the hospital last week for chest pains cause I almost passed out, they found Gallstones, so I now have to have my gallbladder removed!! Pristiq may have helped my depression, but I think its killing my body. I want off, but I'm afraid of the withdrawls!

column2: autumnalfall, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on anti-depressants for 12 years. The last 6, i was on effexor XR 225 mg. But i started experiencing zombie-like effects, wanting to sleep all of the time, lack of motivation, and i definitely couldn't keep up with my 4 yr old and i'm only 25! I decided to try Pristiq, since it was similar to effexor xr, which had worked for a good amount of time. I was told i could just stop the effexor, without weaning, and replace it with the 50mg Pristiq. Bad idea. Horrible withdrawal. So i weaned myself off Effexor, while taking Pristiq, and felt much better. Since being on Pristiq alone, i feel more alert, energetic, and easy going. I'm not sleeping 10+ hours. I feel well rested after 7-8 hours. The only side-effects i've had have been slight withdrawal a few hours before my next dose, but i feel that will go away after a few more months. I do get more frequent headaches, but the benefits have outweighed something a dose of Tylenol fixes. Of course, this medication will not work for everyone. It took many different meds before I had success with one. And yes, withdrawal from any SSRI can be horrible, but you need to slowly lower the dose, over several weeks, or even months, to lessen the severity. Never stop cold turkey.

column2: lolapcatt, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I like it! For once in my life, there is an antidepressant thats not causing me to be sluggish or gain weight.  If you can make it past the week, there is a nasty headache and nausea, but it subsides on the 7th day. i took the pill at bedtime and the nauseas and headache were not as bad. after a about three weeks, i woke up from my funk! suddenly everything was clear and my mind was able to focus. and i can tell when i skip a dose.  my friends and family can tell when i miss a dose.  i highly recommend. i cant imagine living with out it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Side effects are horrible. Light-headed feeling when I turned my head. Woke up middle of night with heart racing and felt like I couldn't breathe. I was only on it for 12 days, went back to Dr. with these side effects. Had an EKG which showed irregular rythym (skipping heartbeat). Now I have to go back for echocardiogram, stress test and possible heart cath. Don't chance this. It needs more study and more emphasis on these horrible side effects. It should be taken off the market. It also made me sweat so bad like an intensified hot flash and more frequent.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Pristiq for several months now, after switching from Lexapro.  I have very few side-effects, and it has helped me feel "normal".  I don't find that this anti-depressant makes me numb to anything that happens; however, I do feel like it helps me cope better through clear thinking.  I still have emotions (As opposed to the lack of emotion I had with previous drug therapies), but they are not over-taking my life.  I can tell a huge difference when I exercise, too, due to the natural de-stressor that provides.  The one negative I will say is how I feel if I miss a dose.  I wouldn't say that I felt like I was going to "die" as a previous poster had, but there was intense dizziness.  Remember: everyone is different, and it may affect you different than any of us posting.  Be open-minded about the drug therapies, and add a little bit of exercise in somehow, or talk to a therapist.  I believe that the successful treatment of depression comes from a variety of things, not just a drug.

column2: lollyo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had depression since I was 5 years old. I tried wellbutrin,zoloft, in my teens with no results, prozac worked for me for 10 years then stopped working. I then tried celexa and it worked for 2 yrs then stopped. I have just tried to live with my depression and anxiety for many years. After my hysterectomy a few years ago my depression has been harder to overcome, especially since my husband was recently diagnosed with bipolar and all the problems that come with it, as well as my having a chronically sick child at home. My doctor put me back on prozac which (within 3 days)made my depression 100 times worse than ever! She then suggested I try the Pristiq because so many of her patients were having great results. Within 2 days I was feeling better than I had my whole life! The only side effects were dizziness,slight vivid dreams,mild nausea(all just for the first week)and my appetite is so much easier to control now! I have gained 90 pounds since my hysterectomy and was always starving,with sugar and carb cravings, but on Pristiq I actually forget to eat, and am able to make healthy food choices since the cravings are under control. Hopefully with this I can lose weight and get my newly diagnosed diabetes under control. I feel like I have hope for my depression now and I don't feel as socially anxious, nervous, and withdrawn from people. I have had several mild headaches since taking this but overall I am feeling great! I have temporary Medicaid which (suprise) does cover this medication, but I am concerned about paying for it when my Medicaid runs out. I have been on this medication for just over 4 weeks now.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was started on this medication about 3 weeks ago for Fibromyalgia. To my surprise, I'm not having that horrible pain anymore. I'm also not noticing any side effects. The first couple of days I was kind of gassy but that went away. I take it every evening after dinner.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Pristiq for about 2 years now. I have missed doses in the past and it is very frightening. I thought I was dying the first time it happened. Then I called my doctor and looked online, and realized this is normal if you miss a dose. So now I feel like a prisoner. I'm scared to go off the medication because I never want to feel that again! I think the effectiveness of the drug has worn off significantly in the past year or so. Since I have been on it for so long, I don't know if it is just life situations or the meds that are causing me so much grief. I have zero energy all day, I am sore when I wake, I have to fight napping and most of the time I give in. I have had bad days more and more often. I feel like this drug no longer is helping me, but I am scared to go off of it and I am also weary of going back to the routine of trying new antidepressants. It sounds awful.

column2: sasha, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: aurorix didnt help me ...another doctor changed me tothis medication..as i also had anxiety symptoms..it has helped :)

column2: half-baked-lasagna, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Wow, reading some of these comments really scares me.  I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia in 1998, endometriosis in 2001, (for which I've had over two dozen surgeries and due for another), and have degenerative disc disease and a herniated disc since 1994, all causing debilitating pain. The pain in turn has caused severe depression, and I was first prescribed Paxil. After taking it for a few months, I tried to commit suicide by downing a whole bottle.  I didn't take anything for a few years, lost my 2-week-old son (born 15 weeks early, due to endo.)  Shortly after, I was prescribed Effexor, Doxepin, and Xanax.  I felt great until I lost my insurance and had to stop everything at once.  A few months later, I got pregnant with my daughter, so couldn't take anything, but shortly after she was born, new Dr. disagreed with fibro diagnosis and prescribed Prozac, which drove me so nuts I wanted to pull my hair out, then Wellbutrin, same results, then Zyprexa,an anti-psychotic that screwed with my depth perception and caused me to fall and injure myself more than a few times, then Trazadone, Remeron, Ativan, Klonopin,Cymbalta,, which caused severe vomiting.  Finally another drug that, when I told my Dr. I wanted to drive off a bridge, she suggested a 5150/psych evaluation in the hospital for 3 days.  Sorry, I'm a mom and I'm not crazy.  Returned to original Dr. about five months ago and started taking Pristiq.  What a difference.  I felt an overall calmness one day, and so much stress seemed to just fade away.  The only problems I have had are weight gain, (enough for my Dr. to check my thyroid, LOL), and if I don't take it first thing in the morning, I vomit for the rest of the day, even if I take it later in the morning, and I see the full tablet in the vomit.  I know it's gross, but I'm really concerned, tonight I came home with my daughter and had to pee really bad, and as soon as I sat down, I threw up.  No warning, no nausea, headache, nothing.  This has happened twice

column2: bmurie, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began taking Pristiq around Nov/Dec 09.  I was on Prozac before and wasn't getting results from it.  After discussion with the doctor he decided to change me to Pristiq. He started me on 50 mg then increased to 100 mg and then to 200 mg before I felt 'normal'.  However, Jan 2010 I went from being on 'cloud nine' to planning my suicide and was very depressed.  I went to my monthly psych appt and my doctor was shocked to hear of my drastic change.  After that visit I begged my husband on valentine's day to let me die because the pain (depression) was too overwhelming.  Seeing my husband collapse before me in tears I decided to slowly wein myself off this drug and the other mood stablizer (Lamotrigine 200 mg).  I reduced both to 100 mg for 3 weeks then reduced to 50 mg for two weeks then went 'cold turkey'.  Believe it or not I started feeling better.  I am still off the drugs (all) and I feel better off of them than I was on them.  My problem is that they would work for a month or two then symptoms would get worse. The drug has some major side effects especially if you miss a dosage.  I recommend those struggling with depression and finding the right medication talk to your doctors about possible other hormone imbalances that might be the reason for your depression.  I have thyroid nodules and borderline hypothyrodism (according to my doctor) which can cause mood changes such as depression.  Just FYI!  I pray that each of you find the right answer to your struggle to overcome this illness.  Remember that you are not alone in this struggle and there are so many options for treatment and causes...God bless you and keep you.

column2: Cbon8686, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was taking Lexapro for about a year for depression/anxiety. This worked very well,but then rather quickly put on twenty pounds.  The Dr. was sure it was the Lexapro so switched me three months to Pristiq.  I switched in one day with a perfect transition.  Then after after about one month started EXTREME fatigue. Literally have slept weekends away.  Can barely get through a workday and have to go to bed before dinner.  I just realized it has to be the Pristiq.  I have appt to make changes yet again.

column2: cabogirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I initially reviewed this drug after taking it for a couple of months & at that time, other than the initial side effects that I experienced (insomnia, jittery, etc..) I was very satisfied, it lifted me out of my depression and helped me get through a difficult period in my life. Fast forward 6 months and my view of this drug has changed entirely. For me, Pristiq after about 2 months, I became very tired throughout the day, my blood pressure increased, triglycerides & cholesterol increased (which I had never had a problem with prior to taking the drug), and overall - I just didn't feel good. I saw another Dr. who helped me ween off of the drug... and let me just say - what a nightmare! I've never been on any other antidepressant so I have nothing to compare it to, but this has been a truly miserable experience.. so much so that I will never go back on ANY antidepressant. Extreme dizziness/vertigo (which I've learned are brain zaps), nightmarish dreams, insomnia again, headaches, irritability. The list goes on & on. I stopped taking Pristiq nearly 2 months ago & am just now beginning to feel normal again. I still have the occasional zaps & dizzy feeling. For awhile I was scared that they would never go away! I understand this drug works wonders for some people, I just have to caution you about the withdrawal symptoms when you decide to discontinue the med. This is a difficult (if not impossible) drug to taper down as most of us are prescribed the lowest dose to start off with  - 50 mg. I tried the every 36 hours, every other day, every 2 days - and it was like my body was on a roller coaster. Finally decided after 3 weeks to just cold turkey it. And the nightmare began! Anyway - this has been a long review - I apologize... I just would not recommend this drug to anyone if for no other reason that the awful withdrawal symptoms.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I really liked the way this medicine affected my mental state. When I was on it I had the desire to go out and do things again. I have since had to stop taking this medication because I discovered it was giving me a mild form of hives. I ruled out everything else, from bedbugs to fleas (we have a dog.) and the only thing left was the meds because I was getting 'bit' and my husband was not. My doctor told me to stop taking the medicine for a few days. Going off of it cold turkey was a very big mistake. The hives stopped, yes, but I was constantly dizzy. When I got home from work I started crying, laughing and shaking all at the same time and I could not stop. I screamed and kicked things and felt like I had no control over myself at all. I wanted to kill myself. My doctor and I will have a talk about this wonderful idea of hers...but I wanted to warn others about what could happen.

column2: heartfelt3, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: i have watched my loved one take pristiq for 2 weeks. The 1st few days were kinda like an energy boost, seemed like medication will help, although, 2 weeks is required before full benefit. By the 5th day, less energy causing more forgetfullness. After one week, memory loss worsens during conversations, headache's & very sleepy during the day. I witnessed an almost passing out, while my loved one was driveing a car, and that is VERY SCAREY TO OBSERVE! My concern level orbited at that moment. The next day, while watching a favorite movie, my loved one passed out. I Thank God we were home.  I would say to Everyone, Please check out your prescribed medication before agreeing to take it. your dr.'s may be educated in your symptom's, but we know our body and mind. Your loved ones can help pay special attention to  side affects, so  before decideing what your going to be dealing with, its in our best interest to talk it over with someone close, and keep dr.'s informed, because so many of us love so much of you, we are there and we care. Learning skills are far more beneficial than relying on a pill, and even when medication is needed, so is therapy, and that does not come in the form of a pill. My loved one say's, i'de rather deal with my depression than feel like this, because i felt better when i woke up, had breakfast. And then, i took my pill, and now i can't stay awake.  Now, we will not give up, but will stop the medication, and continue to be educated. My prayers are with you, and always hold onto something you love in your heart. God bless you all.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on Zoloft 50 mg and wanted to change to another med because of the affective flattening, apathy and sexual side effects I was having. My doctor switched me to Pristiq 50 mg. I felt more energetic than I had on Zoloft, but the sexual side effects persisted and even worsened. Also, after about a week, I started experiencing irritability, never-ending hunger and bloating, which I honestly chalked up to PMS. The timing made sense to me. However, after I got my period, the assumed PMS remained and even worsened, as did the weight gain. I was in a rage, swearing at people in cars, breaking things around the house, and so on.  I called my doctor to see if these were transient concerns and he immediately took me off the Pristiq and put me back on Zoloft to get my mood stabilized before coming up with another plan.

column2: Ally, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Beware of this drug! column2: annabella, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: What I want to stress is NOT that this is the best drug for depression out there, but rather that it is the best drug for depression FOR ME. I had no idea before I began taking the Pristiq that the experience of taking an SSRI could even be this satisfying...it is seriously as if I am taking nothing, but I feel normalized after serious and prolonged depression. No side effects (okay, some teeth clenching and foot shaking, but that's nothing compared to the others I tried), works like an amazing charm.The moral of my testimonial is that you SHOULDN'T GIVE UP! Keep trying different antidepressants until you find the one that works FOR YOU! Everyone's brain chemistry is slightly different, so what works for me isn't necessarily the answer for you. But there is hope (I had nearly given up on the whole SSRI thing)! Keep trying!

column2: can't remember, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I couldn't wait for 24 hours to pass so it could get out my system and I could feel "normal" again. Now I'm giving Zoloft a try because it worked for me before.

column2: DeepSouth434, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on a few SSRIs in the past, with little positive effects.  A few years ago, I got on Cymbalta.  I felt it worked well so I stayed on Cymbalta 60 for about 3 years.  Im the kind of person that isnt comfortable being tethered to a drug company, so I always knew I wouldnt be on ADs forever.  My job ended up changing, and with it so did my insurance, so I decided it was a good opportunity to drop the Cymbalta.Over the course of about 6 months, I felt myself slowly drifting back into my previous depressive/anxious personality.  So one day I decided it's time to go back to the Dr and get on something else. I was impressed with my progress on Cymbalta, so I wanted to try another SNRI.  Cymbalta made it difficult for me to wake from naps, and most importantly, it killed my libido.My Dr. put me on Pristiq this time.  I probably shouldnt be writing this since I've only been on it for a week, but I have been surprised at how quickly I feel like I'm turning back into "me".  I mean, the me that I really am; the one that the depression and anxiety without meds would keep under constant lock and chain (cheesy metaphor I know).I give this drug 4, 5, 4 because to me it's completely trivial to take (ease of use), and I don't have enough time on it to give it 5 stars.

column2: jade989, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Before starting Pristiq, my first experience with antidepressants was with Zoloft for a couple of months (increment in dosage from 25 mg to 100 mg over the course of treatment). I felt better with Zoloft, it worked for my anxiety and depression in general terms.  I stopped taking it because i kept experiencing  difficulty to focus and concentrate, which i thought were interfering with work.  I was off it for a couple of months, taking just an ocasional clonazepam to relieve anxiety.  All symptoms resumed, lost that job and oddly enough I found work as a secretary with my psychiatrist.  He put me on Pristiq (don't have insurance and he has plenty of samples).  I started on 50mg Pristiq and the first couple of days i felt some improvement of my symptoms (my Dr. says it's the "placebo" effect cause it takes a couple of weeks for it to work).  Weeks went by and i became worried Pristiq has not been working for me.  He keeps insisting that i stay on it.  He upped my dossage to 100mg (no 100 mg samples, so 2 50mg every morning). Still no improvement.  As someone noted here, i have also been experiencing difficulty losing weight even though i started walking about 2 miles 3 times a week, though no weight gain either.  Anyway, i think im going to stop with Pristiq and go back to zoloft.  What im really concerned about is my problem with focus and concentration that has not improved on either of these meds. Also, my memory is a mess.  Im REALLY forgetful.  For example, i rent a dvd this week and maybe 2 weeks later i completely forget that i saw it (and so on). Sorry for the long post, just wanted to share my experience and also if anyone has any insight on my concerns, they would be greatly appreciated.

column9: Pristiq has really helped me over a traumatic experience that I was going through at the time. I did have a few side effects during the first week of treatment which mainly consisted of feeling extremely fatigued. I did experience loss of appetite in the first couple of months but this was not long term. I eat well and exercise regularly but have found that it is difficult for me to lose weight (though I haven't gained, which is probably due to my healthy lifestyle). I'm in the process of discontinuing the medication because I feel that I no longer need it. The withdrawals are horrible. I feel like I have vertigo and get nauseated while riding in the car. The doctor suggest that I cut my pills in half, take daily for a week, then take half a pill every other day for a week, every two days for a week, etc. If this doesn't work then she will give me Prozac to take for a couple of weeks while the pristiq is getting out of my system. column2: No good, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: Scott, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had an amazing experience on Pristiq.  Within just a couple days, a calm seemed to descend on every aspect of my life -- I had greater peace of mind and was more able to enjoy the small moments.  It's now been 2.5 months, and it's still great.  Anxiety and performance fear also greatly reduced.  I had previously been on Lexapro (1 year) and Zoloft (off and on for 10+ years), and so far Pristiq has been far superior for me.  Great results without feeling "drugged".  Noticed a decrease in appetite, but not nausea.  Other than that, no discernible side effects.  In fact, sexual side effects seem less than Lexapro and Zoloft.  Don't normally post to these things (never have, in fact), but wanted others to have the benefit of a positive experience.  Thanks.

column2: AprllRain, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med for a short period of time. I find I have energy and i sleep well at night. I haven't had a good nights sleep in so long. I handle stresses better, I actually don't stress as easy as I use to. Even my family has noticed a big change in me. There's so much more that I feel has changed I couldn't fit it all in here. I've read the bad things about this medication. But not all medications are made for all people and to those people, I'm sorry it didn't work for you. All in all I FEEL THE BEST I'VE FELT IN A LONG TIME!!!!!

column2: Annomily, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was put on Pristiq after the death of my husband a little over a year ago. I have used other anti-depressants the last 20 yrs. of my life. It gave me the energy to go to work, but I was exhausted when I got home. The last day I worked Aug.2nd. I don't remember any of that day. The Doctors said I had a seizure, I'd never had any before. The fall at work broke my skull, ct scans showed I had a spot on my brain. Doctors don't know if the spot was from a stroke [which they have basically ruled out now] or if the spot was from the fall. Either way, my Doctor belives I had a seizure from using the Pristiq. DON'T shruge off any weird feelings, tingleing, or numbness. Call your Doctor or if severe go to your hospital. I was taken off the Pristiq immediatly. I am now on seizure medication, due to the fact the Doctors don't really know what caused my seizure. I am still off from work, and won't tentivly be released to go back to work till after Jan. 2010.I'm only telling my experiance of using Pristiq. Take care of your self, read warning lables and question your Doctors.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

Also, it is considerably less $$ than the Lexapro if you get the card that gives 50% off the co-pay. Overall I am very pleased at this time.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I thought that I would write this because I have read so many negative things about this drug. Because of reading all of the negative remarks, I became very reluctant to taking this medication. I just kept putting it off because I was so worried about the side effects that other people had. I have only been on Pristiq for 3 days, but I have not had ANY side effects so far. My mood is pretty positive. I feel way better now than I did on Wellbutrin. Im not sure if this feeling will last or if I will get side effects in the future. I just wanted to write this for everyone out there who might be a little scared of taking it because they fear the worst from what they've read. Everyone reacts differently to medicine. If you really are depressed and need a good AD, then give it a try for a bit. You really dont have much to lose. Also, the first 2 days that I took Pristiq, I made sure that I was around other people and that they knew that I was taking a new medicine. They checked on me throughout the day and made sure I was alright.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I have been taking Pristiq for almost a year now.  The anxiety/panic attacks are gone and so is the PMDD/PMS.  I have the night sweats though and haven't had as strong of orgasms. column2: kimmyannrn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Don't ever, ever take this medicine.  I took 50mg daily for 5 weeks and nearly died.  I developed acute onset serotonin syndrome that took 3 docs to diagnose.  With this syndrome I had a severe headache, vomiting, memory loss, high fever, tremors, shivering, passing out episodes with head injury, black eye and a visit to the hospital for testing and a head CT.  I literally lost a week of my life, couldn't get out of bed, had difficulty staying awake, had hallucinations and was delusional.  Terribly scared my children when they witnessed my 2nd passing out attempt.  My first passing out attempt was unwitnessed and my husband found me with a black eye.  I was texting numbers instead of letters to my friends and recall none of it.  I had to obviously abruptly stop this Rx and the withdrawal symptoms are nearly as bad as the initial syndrome.  Horrible sweating, headache, dizziness, intolerance to light, insomnia, diarrhea, difficulty concentrating and short term memory issues.  After being diagnosed I discovered that I should have been in the hospital for observation and on IV fluids and ativan for the myoclunus.  This syndrome can be fatal and severe cases end up on the ventilator, chemically paralyzed on diprivan.  This med caused me to roam the house at night and wake up all over the place having no idea how I got there and at one point I tried to leave the house at 3AM and the alarm system woke me up.  Right now I feel very lucky to be alive.  Docs miss this diagnosis often, even docs who prescribe this med.  I have been on a few SSRI'S over the years and never had any kind of problem like this.  Don't ever take this medicine, it is poison.

column2: JerseyCityLady, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Pristiq for two weeks, had been on Lexapro (worked fine but made me drowsy 24/7).  So far, so good.  I feel ok, and the only side effect is a decreased appetite, which is a good thing as far as I am concerned.

column2: Shellguana, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Pristiq for about six months.  I've had so many side effects but did not relate them to the Prisiq until now.  I actually got tested for Lymphoma aftger having swollen lymph nodes and night sweats.  Turns out, it's the the Pristiq.  I have night sweats, headaches, weight gain, unable to lose weight, tinnitus, mood swings, jaw clenching and extreme fatigue.  I quit taking it cold turkey about four days ago and it's been hell.  I'm very dizzy (brain zaps) but I'm hoping it will end soon.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was put on this to treat hot flashes and insomnia.  The first day I dozed all day and felt like crap. The only side affect I noticed was having my legs twitch to the point that it was keeping my husband awake at night.  After being on this for about 5 months, I decided last week to stop taking it to stop the leg twitching.  My hot flashes have not returned, but I have been dizzy and my stomach has been upset since a couple days after stopping taking it.  I have been depressed and breaking into tears at the drop of a hat.  The withdrawl side effects are horrible and hopefully subside quickly.

column2: Irishlass99, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Negative effects: nausea, some diarrhea (but that is mostly over now); headaches; feel like I have a fever, but I could also be fighting off something. Overall, I'm glad I'm on this drug!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column9: I began Pristiq for ADD and binge eating. Pros: Appetite was suppressed, thoughts less scattered. Cons: I am neither depressed nor upbeat/I think nothing much at all now/on autopilot. I have vision disturbances (blurry upon waking, rolling lights later at night-every night when I get really tired). I am generally tired all the time, and am not losing weight from not eating, probably because of tiredness and the constipation. Before with ADD I was to busy to exercise, now I just have no opinion or motivation to. Only now I don't feel like doing anything I was doing before instead either, not in a negative way, but in a zombie/no brain like way. I will probably wean off as soon as possible, it is not worth the way I am thinking and the side effects. It might be useful for someone who was depressed or angry before taking it, but it is probably not for everyone.

column2: WordDoc, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Pristiq has changed my life dramatically! I'd been on Paxil for years with dimishing effectiveness, so my doc switched me to Pristiq, trying me on samples first. I've been on it for over a year and had no side effects or negative reactions.  Within five days of trying Pristiq, I was like a new person! Depression, fatigue, etc.--gone!  Also, I've had no fibromyalgia flares since being on Pristiq, another wonderful effect of this medication.  I've read the negative comments of other reviewers, and I'm so sorry that they have had such bad experiences.  But for others like me, Pristiq is the answer to years of suffering. I would say that people who've had less than effective results from other meds should try Pristiq and see if they would benefit from it.

column2: against pristiq, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While Pristiq helps control the depression it is avery dangerous drug.  If you miss a dose or try to go off it  you will experience severe withdrawl symptoms. This drug is dangerous an should be taken off the market.

column2: newleaseonlife, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Pristiq for almost 6 weeks. This is the first antidepressant I have ever been on, and I was worried about the side effects. The first week was brutal, I was already suffering from insomnia & Pristiq seemed to amplify it 10 fold. Was nauseous and really had no appetite. Side effects subsided after about a week and I am noticing a marked increase in my mood. An unexpected improvement was with my food obsession. I have been struggling with bulimia for 20+ years, and honestly, after taking Pristiq, my urges to binge & purge pretty much disappeared. I have also started counseling as part of my therapy. Overall, I'm very satisfied with Pristiq. If you can just get through the initial side effects, the benefits are worth it.

It's really a great drug, just not for me anymore.

column2: Mr. H, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: I would caution anyone trying a new anti-depressant to stay in touch with your doctor for constant monitoring until you see how your body is going to react to the medication.I had extreme shakiness, confusion, EXTREME depression, I've lost 15 lbs, trouble sleeping, anxiety attacks with horrible heart palpitations.  I was on Pristiq for six weeks and during that time had extreme thoughts of suicide.  Thank goodness my family and friends noticed the extreme change in my personality and helped me to get off it.  I would just encourage anyone trying any of the medications to have family and friends "on watch" to notice any adverse effects.  I have only had to take anti-depressants one other time during my divorce and they helped, but Pristiq nearly killed me.  Beware - Be Cautious.  It may be a miracle for some, but there are a few like myself that didn't reap the benefits.

column2: audrey, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i truly thought that there was a magic pill out there that would cure my depression and anxiety. i have been on 9 different medications since 1998 most recently Pristiq. NONE of the medications i have been on have helped because there is no magic pill. i am NOT telling anyone to stop their medications but i am saying (for most people out there) you have to face what is depressing you-- figure out what it is and try to make peace with it. i did not deal with problems in my life and let them pile up and in 1998 it hit me like a ton of bricks and i ran to the doctor (which at the time i needed on medication to help) but nothing "fixed" ME. i am still depressed my anxiety is better but i have realized my depression is because of choices/decisions i have made in my life, some from 30yrs ago. i am writing this because if i can make just one person understand that there is no magic pill,i put all my hope in a pill and i was let down time and time again. please talk to someone or a support group to help you identify the source of your depression and anxiety and seek help with dealing with the problem. you might benefit from counseling AND medication. i have not. please take care of yourselves and God Bless you all. i wish you all the best.

So I started taking those with the Effexor and Wellbutrin.  I felt GREAT and then he wanted to take me off Effexor - which we did very gradually. That was okay - but after two weeks I started feeling weepy and on edge.  So the doc added 50mg of Pristiq  - which he said was the new version of Effexor.  Well I just took the first pill about 7 hours ago and my stomach is very upset, I feel like the floor is tilting below me, and I feel a bit nauseous - and I never ever feel nauseous.I want my effexor back!  I have a call in to his office - has anyone had problems like this swtiching from Effexor to Pristiq?There must be some differences in the two because I never ever reacted this way to Effexor.  Would love to hear from anyone who has thoughts about this.........  I know I"ve only taken one pill but I really don't even want to take one more tomorrow.The Effexor worked so well - and why fix something if it's not broken.Does anyone else take Effexor and the bi-polar meds I"m taking.....?

column2: Ivana, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: causes chronic constipation : ( that in itself can make you depressed

column2: luvbug5, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got done with my first week on this medication, and i have to say i was pretty nervous after reading all the reviews...but luckily i had very light side effects. My doctor told me to take the meds in the AM, but i would get nauseous and mild headaches, so i started taking it right before i go to bed at around 10pm and i have no side effects. So far, i have not had any real anxiety or any attacks, even though it has only been a week...i hope this helps someone with their decision to take this medication or not, and remember that everyones body is different and will react differently to all medication...so i would take the horror stories that people have posted as a slight warning, not what is for sure going to happen!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Day 10 of taking 50mg Pristiq.  Yesterday, was very tired and mood low, but was able to accomplish more than I thought.  This morning, to my amazement, not as tired and mood is better.  Jury still out as to if this A/D will work.  Overall, minimal side-effects.

column2: erin h, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this medication in June while I was at a month long stay at a hospital. I have been dx'd with severe PTSD, DID, bipolar, major depression, and borderline personality disorder.  I started pristiq after I was taken off of cymbalta, lithium and trilafon.  I now take wellbutrin and pristiq with no antipsychotic or mood stabilizer.  I am no longer chronically suicidal, I don't feel depressed for the first time in my life and I feel like there are opportunities opening up for me for the first time in my life.  I have noticed some upper digestive issues since starting this drug and a worsening of my irritible bowel but that is taken care of with another medication.  These side effects are minor compared with the benefits of pristiq.

column2: bugger,  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Day 7 of taking 50mg prestiq.  Woke up very tired, but after a couple of cups of strong coffee, tiredness has decreased.  Mood continuing to improve -- less anxiety noted, but increase in appetite. Food tastes amazing! (not good)  Otherwise, not much in the way of side-effects.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have been battling major depression for years. This is my 6th day taking 50mg of Pristiq. The first 4 days I was agitated and jittery and had insomnia.  5th day, some improvement in mood and starting to feel sleepy.  6th day...feel mood lifting, much more energy, thinking is clearer...not experiencing much in way of side-effects. Have tried so many A/Ds with minimum success.  Am amazed at how much better I feel today. Hope it lasts.  So far, so good.

column2: PBJ, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Today is day 9 for me. My ONLY complaint is that i have a terrible hot burning sensation in my legs and feet when i try to go to sleep. It has kept me awake till 4am most nights. But i am willing to deal with it and hopefully my body will adjust in time. (I also take Adderall 30mg daily, which probably doesnt help.) But otherwise the Pristiq has worked WONDERS for me. I noticed a change on day 5. No more "overthinking" or "dwelling". Suddenly those thoughts and behaviors were blocked and my mind wont even go there anymore. I LOVE IT!! I can actually function normally and have a focused clear state of mind and thought. Pristiq has also curbed my appetite. Sure i feel a little nausea once in a while, but trying to find clothes that fit makes me feel even sicker! Stick to the program, and think positive. I have taken other meds for this, and have never had such positive results!!

column2: momola, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 50mg of pristiq for 5 days now.  I found that the only side-effect I experienced was some insomnia and some edginess.  On 4th night insomnia subsided.  I also take Strattera 60mg as an adjunct to increases antidepressant effect of pristiq.  First 3 days I also felt sort of wired -- like I had drunk about 20 cups of coffee, but that has now stopped. Also taking Strattera 60mg to boost antidepressant effect of pristiq.  Otherwise, no major side effects to report.  Strattera may be off-setting side-effects to Pristiq??

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: seekingserenity, 35-44 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I am so glad I stuck out the side effects because I feel the best I've ever felt. No side effects at all, I am so happy now. Everyone I work with and family and friends have commented on the amazing change in me. This drug is awesome once you get past the side effects.

column2: Jan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I do find that when outside in the heat sweat pours off my forehead with little or no exertion.

column2: DMAC, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Took Effexor XR 75mg for over two years with no side effects. At 150mg I noticed some sweating, trouble sleeping and sex problems. Got some Pristiq samples at 50mg and I am stopping the Effexor. Why not, Weyth will pay for 50% of my co-pay for life and Pristiq is better for the liver and has less side effects. I know that Effexor is loosing its patent and that Pristiq is barely any different. I feel and extra kick with the Pristiq that the Effexor lost. I have lots of energy and I talk-talk-talk which is a good effect for me. I enjoy chit chat with every body now. I also noticed a slight decrease in the pain I have from injurys. I have high energy now and I can still concentrate which is a rarety.

column2: BikerChic, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This was prescribed to my by a NP who felt that this would ease symptoms of depression that recently have gotten worse. I (with hope) took the first pill when I returned to work from my appointment. It started in my spine, and then worked its way out. It was almost an out of body experience - in my opinion. I felt like I was on speed, with the paranoia that I could not control. Also my heart raced and it felt like while I could think clearly - my brain was SPINNING! I took the 2nd dose on day 2, thinking things would get better, and it actually got worse. I felt like I was being choked, couldn't get my breath and was definetly NOT myself. In fact, I don't know who was in charge - but she was not me. I kept asking my husband if I seemed different and he just said quiet. (Normally I am a chatterbox). The only positive thing was I didn't feel like eating all day. I did want to snuggle with my husband that morning, but there was NO way I was going to be very functional at work. I stopped after the 2nd dose because of the choking feeling - I felt as if my trachea was going to close - and I could not relax/rest. I know I may not have given it time, but there was no way I could continue.  I would rather be depressed that feel the way I felt during those 2 days. I was afraid to do ANYTHING. Even getting my hair done (normally very very positive) almost caused a manic feeling outbreak - I just hope there is something out there that helps - but I don't think this is it. Others reported headache, nausea and I didn't really experience any of those. My first reaction was that it was like speed, weed and a little bit of mushrooms.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Most of the reviews i read for this medicine were negative, so I was a bit skeptical about taking it. But to my suprise, this medication has worked wonders on me!!! I have anger issues linked to depression/anxiety and I no longer go into fits of rage or crying spells or horrible mood swings. I had nausea, loss of appetite and sleeplessness at first, but those side effects have all gone away and I feel like I'm living a healthy and "normal" life again.

column2: wanttofeelhumanagain, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I started Pristiq about 3 months ago and thought it was wonderful.  Now I have gained 10 pounds, for the first 8 hours of my day my head spins and I feel nausea and anxious. I think I would rather be depressed then feel the way I do using this drug.

column2: nes85, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Before starting Pristiq I had trouble concentrating, I was always tired and I was an emotional eater. Pristiq helped me within a week.  I no longer emotionally eat; I have actually lost 25 pounds because I now have the energy to exercise and I am no longer obsessed with food.  I feel like I am more positive and upbeat. The best part is that I can now focus and complete a task instead of my mind running 100 mph without solving anything. It has changed my life, I would recommend this to anyone that has low energy, trouble concentrating, or if you are an emotional eater.

column2: lisa42, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

Was airlifted to another hospital and got the news that my Cholestrol was through the roof and my blood sugar went haywire when taking this drug.  Also had more panic attacks while on the medication.  I will not take this drug again.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Because my depression is new and situational, I cannot really rate effectiveness.  I do know missing pills cause serious withdrawal symptoms.

column2: MaryShowie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I hate to break it to you folks, but you could not feel better hours after taking this for the first time.  I have tried every kind of antidepressant known to man.  This has worked. No side-effects, it took some time - but IT WORKS.  Don't listen to all the negative reviews.  Everyone has a different chemistry so what is deemed "horrible" for one means in no way, shape, or form that this is the experience you will have.  A definite plus is that Wyeth will pay 50% of your co-pay for the course of your treatment because it can get pretty pricey.  I think there are a lot of drama queens/kings leaving feedback.  It works - if you have tried everything else to no avail, give it a try - after all, what have you got to lose??

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: BEFORE I STARTED TAKING PRISTIQ I DIDN'T WANT TO GET OUT OF BED I HAD TO LITERALLY DRAG MYSELF TO WORK AND ALL I WANTED TO DO WHEN I GOT HOME WAS SLEEP NOW I HAVE BEEN TAKING THIS DRUG FOR APPROXIMATELY A MONTH AND I FIND IT EASIER TO GET UP AND GET GOING AND I AM NOT AS TIRED AS I WAS BEFORE I AM ACTUALLY STARTING TO GET OUT AND DO THE THINGS I LOVED DOING BEFORE I AM VERY VERY HAPPY WITH THE RESULTS SO FAR AND THINK THAT WITH TIME I WILL BE BACK TO MY OLD SELF AGAIN AND I CANNOT WAIT!!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column9: Only my fourth day but I feel about 60-70%better already- much more even keeled and balanced.  Not internalizing everything as sad.  I am confident and thankful about this treatment.

column2: debekakes, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Pristiq for 3 1/2 months. I tried Paxil about 5 years ago, only took it about two months, husband wanted me off. I can never tell any difference in my moods, but obviously others can. Pristiq made me sweat more. I have developed oral rashes which I am having biopsed by an oral surgeon. He suggested I stopped taking Pristiq and see if it subsides. Called primary care physician and she said skip every other day for a week and stop taking the med. I hope I can wean off of it okay. She also said Pristiq causes oral rashes. The rashes are very annoying, I hope they go away. I also gained weight, which my doctor said would not happen with Pristiq.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been on this four weeks and it is working so far. been on prozac,celexa,welbutren,andlexapro and so far this is better. Do not let some bad reviews from people keep you from trying it.Everyone is differnt.

column2: Zara, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After reading other people's responses to how this drug affected them, I feel less like the only one that it didn't work for. I have panic/anxiety disorder & had been taking Zoloft, but over time (many years), it stopped working, so I reluctantly switched to Pristiq. Oddly enough, I didn't start experiencing the major side effects until almost 1 month into taking the drug & then it was a nightmare. I had to look up the adverse reactions on the Pristiq website to make sure I wasn't havng some unrelated medical problem, but there they were: Irritability (I'm not that type of person at all), unexplained agitation & anger, muscle weakness & nerve tingling in my left foot, hand and side of my face, racing heart rate, hot flashes & an inability to concentrate. Any type of stress caused my heart rate to skyrocket & my blood sugar to soar (I'm a type 2 diabetic, so this side effect is unacceptable). One of the oddest side effects was an odd kind of partial insomnia that caused me to go into a light sleep phase and have very strange dreams where I was actually talking about how Pristiq was making me have these dreams! Also, I couldn't get to sleep without the aid of another medication (Ativan, in my case), so, overall, this drug really caused more anxiety and frustration than it helped ease my anxiety. It may be better for people in need of anti-depressants, but for anxiety suffers, not so much.

column2: amandansqueak, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

My doctor just keeps increasing the dose, which increases the terrible nausea I get from it.  I have an appointment on Friday, and if she doesn't change my medicine, i'm going to a new doctor!

column2: Ga. Pech, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

Sleep worse, taking more Ambien.  Any similar results?Ga. Peach

column2: Kfalz, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Pristiq for 3 months and it has been the worst 3 months of my life!  Side effects started during 3rd week and included severe nausea, dizziness, fatigue, headaches, night sweating, irritability, weight gain (+15 pounds), vivid dreams, head noises (ch ch sound), and confusion/concentration issues.  Have intermittent episodes of these symptoms and have missed lots of work. Withdrawal is even worse (on day 4). If anybody else is experiencing this, please fill out MedWatch form to complain to FDA at https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/medwatch/m edwatch-online.htm  This drug should never have been approved!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Pristiq for 2 months and I do feel better, have more energy and enthusiasm. I am not experiencing any of the terrible side effects except sometimes slight difficulty swallowing and only just recently some joint soreness in one finger. I have decided that I want to wean myself off only b/c of the frightening reviews I've read here and elsewhere about the terrible side effects when you try and get off of it. I'm more afraid of what it's going to do to me if I have prolong usage and decide to get off of it at a later date rather than just dealing with the depression without medication; if that makes sense. Overall with so many varied opinions on the drug I would recommend that the patient does extensive research before taking the first pill. I did not. I went on my doctors advice b/c I was so anxious for a quick fix.

column9: There ARE alternatives to Pristiq. The reason there is no Wyeth information about the real life experiences of this drug is because it is so horrible. column2: thankyou123, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Pristiq has completely changed my life for the better.  I had a son who died at the age of two and never seemed to snap out of the depression I was in since 2006.  I have never felt better in my life!  This medication works so well that it brings tears of happiness to my eyes writing about it.  My grades in college have went up and my relationship with my 7 year old son and my boyfriend is so much better than before.  My performance at work is also better with almost no error.  I have been on it for 6 weeks now and the first two weeks I had side effects that were unpleasant but it was so worth it to allow my body time to adjust because the side effects are COMPLETELY gone.  Thank you, thank you, thank you for whoever made Pristiq! You gave my son his mommy back!

column2: Bamachick97, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has completely changed my life! I have been on it for over a year and a half now and I have never been happier. When I first started taking it I noticed an immediate decrease in my daily anxiety levels and a noticeable increase in energy levels. It also helps to control my appetite, which is an added bonus. I was reluctant to have to take a daily medication at first, but I now know that I made the right decision. Pristiq has improved my daily outlook on life and my ability to handle stressful situations.

column2: bfrolls, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Rachelle S., 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: In addition to two mood stabilizers (Depakote and Abilify) an anti-psychotic (seroquel) and Klonopin (for anxiety) I take Pristiq for depression associated with Bipolar.  My doctor and I determined that 50 mgs daily was too low, but 100 mgs pushed me into a mania, so I take 50 one day and 100 the next, which is a bit unusual, but seems to be working for me with little or no side effects on this dosage.  I was previously on Effexor XR, which gave me gastrointestinal issues and headaches, but was fairly effective for awhile with my depression.  After several years however, it became ineffective.  Pristiq has improved my mood and sleep quality as well, without the side effects.  It took over a month to notice, but it has been effective.

column2: PristiqLover, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on 50mg per day for 3 days, but my depression and fatigue lifted instantly! I actually have the energy to get off the couch and function,thrive even. But,it is hard to sleep at night. I've been experimenting by taking it at 5 AM,or even 4:30. If worse comes to worse, I will take prescribed 12.5 mg Ambien CR around 10PM. Also, not as hungry,which is good for me.

It's been about 2.5 months and now I'm starting to have terrible short term memory loss.  I can't remember conversations I had only 5 minutes prior.  I'm starting to feel tired and loopy and just overall stress and tension again.  I don't want to increase and I don't want the trouble of switching, so I'm really at a loss as to what to do. My overall health is very good with a low BP.  I am overweight and I struggle with weight loss, so I don't want anything that'll make me gain. (thereby increasing depression??) Any suggestions? Please...

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Pristiq for a little over six months, and of all the medications I have taken, it has been the most effective for my depression.  There are some side effects I had not had before.  I had horrible night sweats for the first few months, which have decreased, but are still there sometimes.  I also have trouble sleeping from time to time.  It also seems to make my anxiety a little worse, but I take 1 mg of Klonopin to help with that.  The worst side effect I have noticed is when I missed one dose.  I immediately got flu like symptoms.  I had a headache, was very stuffed up, and felt completley disoriented.  I take this medicine with Lamictal, and the combination of the two have kept my moods pretty steady.  Overall, I am happy with this medicine and would recommend it.  It has some side effects, but not the usual ones I ran into with the other meds like serious bouts of depression, forgetfulness and weight gain.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Greetings, curious readers! My story.. I was truly beginning to believe I was never going to feel better. Keeping positive I kept up with my own research to hopefully find something that would work for my depression and anxiety. Finally! Pristiq!! Don't get me wrong, it's been a long road! There have been a few side effects. A bit of sleeplessness, some hot flashes, but in just a short time these have gone away. Now I feel 100% better. My energy has come back, my outlook is changing, my fibromyalgia symptoms are down and I feel 100% better. Please! Don't give up. I have read allot of less than satisfied results here. But keep in mind, all things take time. Keep yourself positive in your thinking and keep active. Just don't give up! If Pristiq is truly not for you something will lead you to what is. It's a beautiful day, give someone a smile! TJ- Tampa, FL

column9: Pristiq is not working for me. column2: Robin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I've only taken Pristiq for 2 days, but so far so good. The only thing is sweats and insomnia. I've had Depression for years and no medication actually worked for me. I took 14 of them. You have to look at the drug information after a Dr. gives it to you. You should never go off the med unless the Dr says so. It will give you side effects. The last med I was on was Lexapro 20mg and it gave me irritability and road rage etc. I was told to decrease down to 10 mg of Lexapro for a week and then start the Pristiq. Due to withdrawal symptoms I started on the Pristiq right away. I am taking 50 mg of this one. I feel confident and do have energy bursts. I feel cloudy in the head at times, but can tolerate that. The ones that had bad experiences with Pristiq obviously it was wrong for them. I hope you can find the right one. It is discouraging when they don't work. I took Paxil, Zoloft, Remeron, Effexor, Welbutrin, Prozac, Lexapro, Celexa, Cymbalta, Pamelar, Trazadone, Elavil, and now I'm on the Pristiq. I'm thinking positive thoughts so far... Good luck for everyone else...

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Initially I was started back on Effexor XR, which I had taken for several years, but stopped about a year ago. I developed bruxism and terrible restlessness, which had never occured the first time I was on it. So, my doctor suggested I try Pristiq, the "low side-effect" version of Effexor XR. My symptoms got no better. It was misery - I continued to take it for 1 1/2 months because my mood was so much improved, but ultimately had to stop because of the side effects - my jaw was always sore from the bruxism, I had chronic canker sores from the jaw tightening and tongue movements. The restlessness was horrific, I could not sit still - far worse than my occaisional restless leg syndrome. After quitting my symptoms gradually resolved, but it took about 2 1/2 weeks - longer than the half life of the drug, but then my side-effects weren't even listed as common or rare. However, I most definitely experienced them.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 2 1/2 weeks on Pristiq, my slight dizziness turned into severe dizziness.  Never ending diahrea also started at this time.  Before the diahrea, I had severe pain in my left side.  Completely opposite to the other reports I've seen of drowsiness, I cannot sleep.  My mind  races.  I also believe that I have had some low level manic episodes which are not common to me.  I began taking Pristiq as a replacement for Lexapro which no longer seemed to be working.  I feel no difference in my level of depression after taking Pristiq for 2 1/2 weeks.  I stopped taking Pristiq yesterday and today the dizziness and diahrea are still awful.  I have taken many anti-depressants in 20 years and this is the worst I have felt.  Gladly I do not work tomorrow so I can stay home and attempt to feel better.

column2: PSJ71, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started Pristiq in February 2009, after it being prescribed by my bariatric doctor to help with appetite.  About 2 weeks into it, I noticed a decrease in appetite and cravings, which was great; however, I didn't have a refill on my prescription and the pharmacy sent a faxed request, which didn't get to the doc in time, so I went 2 days without it.  I have to say this is THE worst I have EVER felt on ANY medication!  I wish I would have found the information regarding the horrible side effects if discontinuing this type of medication! I know what people talk about when they say they have "electric-shock type symptoms", horrible headaches, and a feeling on going to sleep of being pulled internally into "something" and not being able to move if I let myself drift off slightly.  I am now trying for the second time to stop.  My doc told me there is no "weaning" to this medication and to just stop it if I wanted to stop.  Right now, I feel down, tired and frustrated.  I also noticed while taking it I flew off the handle and stayed angry if something upsetting were to happen.  I just want OFF and never to go back on any of these types of meds no matter how desperate to lose weight! Steer clear of this med.

column2: carol, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Person In Pain, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Pristiq for 1.5 months. Initially it helped with my depression, but the side effects started to become intolerable. I felt like I was burning up and sweating bullets at work...not good. I did like the appetite suppression:) I became worried when I began to suffer from nausea and sharp pains and cramping in my abdomen. I started my period on this medicine, and I still have not stopped bleeding. I have NEVER bled for more than a few days, and I've been bleeding for over a month now. I also noticed blood in my stool. Not good. I stopped taking the drug 5 days ago, and I have been suffering horrible withdrawal or "discontinuation syndrome." I'm still bleeding. I couldn't stand upright today due to the stabbing pains in my abdomen. I'm having a lot of confusion, mood swings...I become angry or tearful for no reason. I'm having nightmares. I feel cold & shiver, even in a warm room. I feel like my insides are shaking. My anxiety has been almost unbearable...I have a constant feeling of impeding doom. I believe I'm having what others have described as "brain zaps." I have missed an entire week of work, wondering when this horror will end. I'm scared. I've made appts to see my GYN, GI doc, and psychiatrist. I feel dizzy and faint when I stand up. This is worse than the withdrawal I experienced after stopping Effexor XR several years ago. God help me!

column9: This was the 6th try in a list of antidepresssants that havent worked for me. I've been on Pristiq for 7 months and have been miserable since I started. I really hope that others have better luck with this drug than I did.  I know each of us have different reactions to different drugs and this one has been the worst for me. Previous drugs I've taken (Prozac, Remeron, Paxil, Wellbutrin, Effexor and a low dose anti psychotic med along with Prozac.  That was a disaster for me.
