column2: girlingeorgia, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have severe OCD mainly obsessions.  I also have severe depression.  This medicine saved my life.  I never knew what it felt like to "feel" normal without anger and mood swings. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My symptoms prior to taking Pristiq included extreme tiredness, anxiety, and mood swings.  All of these symptoms have increasingly diminished over the course of my treatment using Pristiq. However, there are some side effects I have experienced which have been rather difficult to deal with.  First, and foremost, the weight gain and inability to lose weight while on Pristiq has been a challenge.  I went from no exercise at all to jogging 2-4 miles, 4 times per week and have only maintained my weight.  Second, my sex drive had completely depleted.  However, I am now slowly decreasing my dose in order to stop taking Pristiq and my sex drive has been normal again.  Lastly, in order to stop taking this med, you must ween off of it slowly.  This has been very difficult for me.  Nausea, vivid dreams (to the point of night sweats), dizziness, and sensitivity to light have taken place.  Luckily, I have taken a couple of months off of work and have a couple of weeks until I start again.  This has given me the time to be able to stay home and deal with these symptoms.  My therapist warned me of this, therefore, I was somewhat prepared to get off of Pristiq before I start work again.  Pristiq was highly effective in the treatment of my depression symptoms and has aided in my overall therapy.  I am ready for the next step in my life, after all of these side effects decrease!  I recommend Pristiq, however, just know what you are getting into when you want to stop taking it.

column2: livinglife, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this medicing for about 6 months now, and while it's helped in some areas, the side effects are certainly a pain. The vivid dreams, night sweats, and meatallic taste have been a little hard to handle. I can't drink unflavored water anymore because of the metallic taste I get in my mouth. Also, if you miss a dose it's truly a nightmare of a day until you remember to take it. "Brain zaps", shakiness, fatigue, nausea, and all of that other good stuff. It's very much like withdrawl. However, those symptoms are useful in one way, it's very rare you forget to take the meds, and you always know when you missed a dose!

column2: KellieB, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was taking Lexapro for depression, anxiety, and PTSD (mild) but the weight gain was too much to handle (45 lbs. in 7 months). My doctor suggested Prisiq which I took "over" my Lexapro as I came off of it. It took 3 weeks to get completely off the Lexapro and totally on the Pristiq and I am not sure I like the change. My head feels like it weighs a ton, I have vivid dreams and night sweats to the point I have had to change sleep clothes in the middle of the night, my sense of taste and smell are totally messed up (everything seems to have a metallic taste and the most insignificant smell - laundry sheets, moisturize, soap - make me physically sick). Please! Does anyone else out there have any of these side effects? On top of that, I've gained another 3 lbs. I've read so many of these reviews, I've researched Pristiq on other sites, I've tried so hard to find something that will work for me. Prozac, Cymbalta, Wellbutrin, Effexor, Lexapro, and now Pristiq. If I didn't think it would put me in the hospital I would just stop taking anything. So, if ANYONE has suggestions please leave a review. I will check back OFTEN. Good luck to all of you.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: jd530, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried many anti-depresants and have had horrible side effects from them.  I was able to tolerate Welbutrin but had to stop taking it after being diagnosed with bi-polar.  I stopped taking anti-depressants all together and continued on a high dosage of lamictal.  I was o.k. for about 3 months but then the depression kicked in again.  My doctor prescribed pristiq a week ago.  I've had some side effects from this drug-Dizziness, dry mouth, decreased appetite, head ache, trouble staying asleep, night sweat and today blurred vision.  Though many side effects they are minor and my doctor informed me they would subside and encouraged me to hang in there.  I don't feel depressed anymore.  I snapped at one of my good friends last week and now realize it wasn't a big deal and feel horrible about being so mean to her. Please note that in most cases medication alone does not help, regular counseling is a sanity saver, I know from experience.  Do not expect to get better with meds alone. Good luck to you all and hang in there.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: I have been taking Pristiq for over 4 months now. This did help with anxiety and what some may call a bipolar disorder. I do have a word of caution. This is not a magic pill. This drug is marketed as a treatment for depression but you will find that it can pack a punch that you may not expect. I personally do not mind the jittery feeling because that does go away. But what you will find after taking for an extended period of time is a strange feeling in your brain when you miss a dose. You may want to sit down or get a passing out feeling. You may experience brain zaps (if you do not know what they are keeping taking the med and you will find out). Would I recommend this drug? Not sure. I have stopped taking for two days and have never experienced these withdraw symptoms.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Pristiq 50 mg/daily in addition to taking Wellbutrin, which I've taken for several years.  I felt the best I have in years: more energy, more able to focus, better sense of well-being.  However, after two months I developed dizziness/light-headedness, which became serious enough that I discontinued the Pristiq.  My brain felt scrambled.  Many years ago I had the same reaction to Effexor (also venlafaxene) so I could immediately identify the cause of the dizziness and mental confusion.  All of this went away within a week of stopping the Pristiq.  In addition, I had been experiencing a strange intermittent pain on one side of the top of my head, but I hadn't made any connection to the Pristiq.  My doctor actually wondered if I had a brain tumor.  However, after 7-10 days off of Pristiq, all these symptoms disappeared totally.  My psychopharmacologist agreed with my analysis of my symptoms --- and said no more drugs with Venlafaxene for me!  Too bad because I thought I had discovered my wonder drug.

column9: Be careful with antidepressants. My doctor thought I could benefit from this medication and frankly I did too. I stopped the medication 2 days ago. So far I haven't had to many negative side effects from the withdrawal. I was only on the med for 4 days though. I still feel a little nervous, and irratable but my appetite and mood improved almost immediately after stopping. I know this drug has been great for many people, but I would just caution anyone who is new to antidepressants to make sure you truely need something this strong before taking the plunge.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had gone to my doctor last week explaining that the antidepressant medication that I had been taking on and off for 9 years was not taking care of the anxiety and fibromyalgia pain I had been experiencing.  She introduced me to Pristiq and gave me several weeks of samples.  I really had hoped it would work with the holidays coming and having kids at home, etc.  I also feared changing my antidepressant at this time because I didn't want to be more messed up than I already was, especially over the holidays.  The next morning I didn't take my normal celexa dose (40 mg) and I started the pristiq (50 mg).  I could not believe the difference in how I felt and almost wondered if it was all in my head since I had felt so bad for so long because of chronic pain issues, migraines, daily headaches, TMJ jaw pain along with facial and head pain, fibromyalgia symptoms and chronic cervical and shoulder pain.  I felt like doing something for the first time in a long time!!  I felt like life was worth living again and that I do have alot to look forward to in life.  I felt like I used to feel and I truly never thought I would "feel" that way again because of the 25 years of pain issues I had been experiencing.  I have only taken pristiq for 5 days now, but I have only ever had a negative reaction to an antidepressant change in the past.  Because this is a "brand" prescription I am hoping my insurance pays decent, otherwise I will what the pristiq has that the generic brand effexor XR does not have since effexor is also an SNRI.  I am sorry to be so lengthly, but to feel so well is definitely something I want to share with others in depressive states with pain, depression, and anxiety issues.  Good luck to you all!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

It has gotten much better now and the side effects have gone away.  I still have a bit of agitation, but my primary care doc prescribed Xanex for those times.  Overall, I have been satisfied with my experience.

column2: leslie67, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Still new - after 29 years of upgrading and upgrading to the 'latest and greatest' anti-depressants (as well as switching when they don't 'take' or when they, as they all seem to, lose their effectiveness) - I was excited about this as the only other SNRI was Effexor.  It pooped out on me after MANY MANY great years but this one seems so 'light' - no brutal side effects beyond the transient dull headache and dyspepsia.  It's only week 5 but a huge difference is apparent.  That beiong said, I've noticed a lot of you other people with major depression have been experiencing sleep disturbances - me, too...what IS that?  I relate to one guy who spoke of a half-dream-like-sleep"ish" state, others who sleep short periods (usually not enough for REM, right - maybe 2, MAYBE 3 hours?) then are WIDE awake, sometimes bouncing back and forth between 2 hrs sleep, 2 hrs awake AND WEIRD DREAMS!  Anyone else awake panicky for no reason?DOES THIS GO AWAY WITH TIMW??? PLEASE bear some good news, anyone!  Good luck 2 u all!

column2: kgermani@comcast.net, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Due to terrible side effects, stopped Pristiq cold-turkey.  DO NOT STOP THIS MEDICATION ABRUPTLY!  I am having severe paranoia, sobbing, nausea, insomnia, hellish nightmares, worst anxiety ever, feel like my head is going to explode from pressure.  My psychiatrist said this is normal when stopping abruptly, withdrawal peaking at 3 days.  I nearly ended up at the ER.  You MUST taper off slowly when stopping this med.  Work with your doctor or therapist/psychiatrist before just stopping!!!!!

column2: kgermani@comcast.net, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Remember to not only talk to your doctor about this med, but research it! Read the reviews!  Be prepared.  Ask questions.  I have stopped Pristiq and will go back to Celexa. God Bless.

column2: MaryL, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had been on cymbalta for 2 1/2 months for fibromyalgia with no results and increased pain and brain fog. My doctor started me on Pristiq on Thursday. Within just a few days I was starting to feel like my old self. The pain is not gone but greatly decreased, and my brain fog has been clearing. I have now taken Pristiq for 5 days, and today I even put on makeup before going to work.  Every medication does not work for every person, but for anyone who has tried the other medications for fibromyalgia with no improvement I would recommend speaking with your physician to see if he/she thinks this may work for you.  It has been working for me and I am very thankful for this medication. It is nice to feel like me again and to be able function much closer to NORMAL!

column2: amyrele, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 10+ years being happy with Prozac and Wellbutrin, menopause (or some unknown reason) reduced me to the lifelong depressed person I had been as a young adult.  My doctor switched me to Pristiq which seemed to restore a greater level of happiness and sociability.  After a couple weeks though, I "snapped" for a couple days with an irritability I had never known and I was appalled at how mean-spirited my mood was. The doctor explained the manic phase of depression and added zyprexa.  After just a few days, I'm thrilled with my clarity of thought, focus, compassion for others, level of interest in life, ability to enjoy my work, and being able to sleep without worry.  Aside from headaches and more vivid dreams (both of which are acceptable side effects), I am thrilled with the results and wouldn't stop taking it for anything!

I asked to change meds because the Cymbalta I was on made me want to sleep all the time.  After over a month you would expect that to wear off some but, NO!!! I almost fell asleep behind the wheel twice, decided it was time for a change.  The doctor prescribed Pristiq.  After two hours on it I got a burst of energy and actually felt like doing something.  The next day I felt very bubbly and happy for the first time in months and MOST important of all is my sex drive came back.  Mind you I was not on the cymbalta for years either so that may also be a reason I had a change so soon, mabey not.  Yes I have side efects.  I have the ocasional dizzy spell and slight insomnia but, considering all the other side effects I have had to deal with, I am more than willing, and happy to soilder on and see if I continue to feel as good as I do now,even though it is so very early on in the treatment.  My family deserves a happy person, not a mean, snappy grouch.

column2: mommy30, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Duke, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

No thanks to my dr., I researched and found out it made my already high BP higher, did not interact with two of my other drugs, etc. My dr. took me off and replaced with Ativan. I have been 4 days without it and withdrawal symptoms are HORRIBLE. I am experiencing brain zaps--feels like the top of my head is going to explode; dizziness; nausea.

column2: tammy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began taking this drug at the adivice from my doctor because it was suppose the be the same as effexor but a lower dose and easier on the liver but the medication has not worked for me at all causing me to become more deppressed as if I was on no anti-deppressant at all and the anxiety is so bad now that I can't hardly make it out of the house again. I pray that no one else has been effected like this and that special precautions will be taken in prescribing this drug to anyone that is on effexor now. I tried it for 7weeks and am now back to where I was before the effexor and am searching for a new treatment. I pray this review reaches people.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Frequently when my heartbeats I can feel it in my eardrums and my vision "jolts". I have to make sure I take it everyday. It's definitely better than the experiences I had with Wellbutrin, Cymbalta, and many others.

column2: fgth, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Jeffrie Ann, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Pristiq for 3.5 weeks, my depression is getting better. side effects minimul, but I don't loke the blurred vision so far. column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first 2 days all I did was sleep.  After that, no sleepiness.  I do have a dry mouth but other than that, no side effects at all.  I really do feel different since taking the drug - a very good different.  My family has also commented on the change in me.  I was on Lexapro previously and I'm much happier with Pristiq both because of the less side effects and the overall change in me.

column2: Depressednomore, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with chronic depression in 1978 and three years ago with bipolar disorder.  I've taken more antipressants than I could possibly count, none of which have had more than a  minimal effect until I started taking PRISTIQ! About 5 weeks ago my doctor took me off a combination of EffexorXR and Wellbutrin and prescribed Pristiq in their place. He continued my use of Lamictal. The change has been dramatic.  I just woke up one morning suddenly realizing  that I wasn't depressed and I remember thinking "Oh my God, is this was normal people feel like?!" It happened quite suddenly. I'm still feeling some of the confusion and disorientation associated with major depression however my doctor says that these symptoms should subside. I've also noticed a decrease in my need for Xanax and my insomnia has all but stopped. I only wish is that something like Pristiq had been available 40 years ago!

column2: Dana, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken Pristiq for 4 months now. It took about a month to work through switching from 6 years of taking Effexor XR 150mg to 50mg of Prstiq. I am happy with the less side effects and my depression has dissappeared. I still suffer from anxiety, but even that is much less. Overall I am pretty happy with this medication, if you can be happy with one?

column2: GW, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started on 7-9 after yrs. on 300mg Effexor XR w/1 Syncopy episode. Shy of 1mo. on 50mg Pristiq, had a near Syncope episode (collapse w/consciousness). Also, started 36mg Concerta on 7-9. Also, 800mg Seroquel before 7-9 (Yrs.) & after. Other meds before & after 7-9; Micardis 80, Levothyroxine 200mcg, Crestor 10, Nexium 40, St. Joe Aspirin 81. Pristiq same, Concerta stopped, Seroquel 200 & other misc. dosage change (other meds) after 2nd near Syncope. Stopped smoking. I feel good.

column2: linda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I previously reviewed this drug last month, and here to update. Would not recommend anyone take 100mgs.

column1: Extreme Apprehension or Fear of Social Interaction
column2: becalm, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've taken Prozac for years with great results, but after menopause, I was experiencing anxiety again. My doctor suggested changing to Pristiq.  I've taken it for 3 weeks and and cannot take it anymore!! My blood pressure is higher, I have a headache everyday, I'm depressed now, and feel like my brain is scrambled. I do NOT need the norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors. I feel like I'm getting a shot of adrenaline, which I definitely DO NOT need. I'm jumpy enough.  I'm going back tothe SSRIs. Be very careful with this medication if you're anxious or panicky.

column2: celena128, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was perscribed Pristiq for neurological pain from fibromyalgia and treatment of depression from years of pain. Starting SECOND day of use I had much restlessness with a manic episode and along with insomnia.THIRD day of use I had a SEVERE reaction called SERENTONIN SYNDROM and felt like I was going to DIE! Pristiq is AWEFUL medicine... needs to be taken off of the market! On my 3rd day on this medication I had serious mania, restlessness, clamy sweats, extremely fast hearbeat as if heart would burst, dizziness, loss of coordination, shakiness, blacking out lightheadedness, tingling & burning internally of chest... felt as if I was going to die! STAY AWAY FROM PRISTIQ, request alternatives!!!
